description:
I recently started online dating again and needed to find a casual, no pressure bar spot to meet my Bumble Date. My date wanted to meet in the Mission District, and Mosto immediately came to mind! It's in walking distance to BART and two Muni bus lines, so travel was very easy.

Mosto has a great selection of affordable drinks, including local beer, wine, and cocktails. Although I've had their amazing cocktails, including the very delicious Paloma (with mezcal), that particular night I got a pint of the Henhouse pale ale and then a pinto of Modelo Especial. I also love the food and had to get the al pastor tacos--a Mosto must and never disappoints.

With dark walls and candlelight, the space feels intimate. The music and bustle of people (many friend groups and other people on dates) liven the bar. This place is hip without being pretentious, and I often come here by myself just to eat tacos and drink beer. Happy Hour is everyday from 5-7PM. You'll thank me later.
author: Joanna S.

description:
May not be the best place for large parties since it's small but everything else about this place is on point. 

Bartenders are really knowledgeable about their selection, so don't be afraid to ask for a recommendation if you don't know what to get.
author: Juan C.

description:
This place is a total joke. Chipotle is better. To begin with, they serve tomato sauce with basil and try to pass it off as salsa. Taco bell has spicier sauce packets and possibly spicier ketchup packets. I asked if they had anything any spicier. They brought a tray with 4 metal cups one with chipotle chiles and a habañero sauce. Again, no spice. Thinking it was just me my German husband tried it with the same reaction! It could have at least have been flavorful but again, no dice. I ask again for a spicier salsa and I was handed a bottle of Tapatio. I was happy to finally be able to add some flavor to the flavorless "carne asada" I was given on a street taco size tortilla for $5. The carnitas were bland and lackluster. Even the quacamolé & chips were disappointing. How do you screw up those two? The only advantage was the guacamolé was fresh. Congratulations, you got smashed avocados with salt and lime correct, Mr Head Chef. I would assume your last job was working for Chipotle except they know how to make salsa.

The drinks are expensive and again low on flavor. Instead of calling the restaurant a Spanish word like "Mosto" which means "must" they should change the name to "No lo hagas" which roughly translates to "Don't do it" to warn those of us who have had good Mexican food in the Mission to just avoid this over-priced, underflavored lie of a restaurant. 

Avoid at all costs, unless you like spending a grip of money on food you could have ruined at home on your own. Do yourself a favor and go a restaurant that looks like a dump and could possibly have roaches in the Mission. They will know how to make flavorful food that will satisfy you. Yeah, Mosto, I would rather risk a food born illness than waste my money at your restaurant again. The Mexican people who work there should be embarassed at serving such mediocre food. 

At least do a better job of cultural appropriation, Mosto owners. I think I can get better Mexican food in Germany.
author: Megan D.

description: Team of 12 starving runners show up , hangry as hell, thirsty for good food and a variety a flavor and drinking needs. Started off with complimentary chips and amazingly flavored, citrusy, lightly spiced, perfectly seasoned salsa. Then, they satisfied all of us with meats, vegetarian options, fish, happy hour options, and my personal favorite: amazing happy hour sangria- not sweet and with real fruit in it. They also made a killing at our table with their margaritas and beers. Fantastic tacos for sure and I think we had all their available options!
author: Mirtila L.

description:
When I walked in to this place and saw the menu, I felt nostalgic for the awesome cocktail and restaurant scene in D.F. You can tell whoever owns this establishment was inspired by that. You still have some hipster decor you see in SF bars with some touches of Mexico here and there.

I love mezcal and love my Latinx culture and appreciate this place for having so many options. I was really vibing with this place until I noticed other guests freaking out that there was no vodka. In fact, it was a little disheartening. It almost feels like the Mission is still not ready for a place like this and there's misunderstanding with tequila and mezcal. Lol. Regardless, just want to say I appreciate the owner's nod to DF culture and want to come back to try the pulque cocktail
author: Lupita D.

description:
Great service, friendly and helpful staff. Interesting food and drink creations - for the food be willing to try something new!  Cricket anyone...?

The tequila or mezcal flights are a great deal.  Both salsas have a kick!
author: Stacey R.

description:
Still got its charm. Management has changed, menu has changed and quality and flavor have only gotten better, prices a litter higher as well. 

Been coming for 4 years now and it used to have my all-time favorite cheeseburger.. menu changed, burger just got better! HOW?!?!

4/5 Crab tostada-  fresh chilled crab meat, crunchy tostada and nice colorful veggie on top, it was really good but let's call it what it is, it's a bite

5/5 Burger, trust and get it, they have now added ham to it and it elevated the flavor

5/5 ceviche is dime a dozen in this area but you killed it with the sauce, its acidic, spicy, savory, sweet, and some tequila? I couldn't get enough

One burger, a mini tostada, and a ceviche with tips clocked in at ~$55
author: Morgan S.

description:
We tried to order a couple of shots with our cocktails and the bartenders were really rude to us and promised we could have it and later denied us. They knew what they were doing and it was really hurtful. That was our first drink and they didnt serve us after promising by saying we were drunk. It was pretty bad and i'd never visit a place like this ever again. I hope you'll dont too.
The bartenders are the worst.
author: Aaditya R.

description:
To be fair, I'm not a big fan of mezcal or tequila, but even so I think this is an awesome spot to hang out in.

Little on the small side, but there are some tables in the back where you can seat a decent size group of people.  Music was not recognizable, but all of my friends and I were a fan of the music choices and pretty much Shazam'ed the whole night away.  Seems like you can order things from the Tacolicious menu (right next door) but we only looked at the drinks.  

Can I first just say that the mezcal menu is HUGE (think 6+ pages)?  It's a shame that you only get the mezcal menu upon request, because I think this is the highlight of this bar.  The servers are huge fans of mezcal and will walk you through this menu and answer any questions you have for the curious mind on mescal (from how it is made to different styles to stupid questions on difference between mezcal and tequila).  

We were aided by Christian Arizmendi, who was very knowledgeable on mescal and gave us 3 different ones to try (one smoky, one fruity, and one more herbal and vegetable tasting).  He sat down at the table with us with the three bottles and explained the differences between the mezcals he brought.  He even served us one for free, a mezcal de pechuga, which included goat meat drippings.  

Another cute thing here is that the ceiling is lined with glass jars and you can leave messages (almost like a time capsule) in them upon request (no charge).  My three friends and I did this when we went last time.

My advice when you come here: order mezcal; not tequila or any familiar cocktail you usually order, but MEZCAL.  Come in with an open mind and pick the waiter's brain a bit and explore the world of mezcal.  Even if you don't like the drink, like me, you at least will walk away impressed by how knowledgeable the staff is on mezcal.
author: Audrey H.

description:
The bar is great, the food/prices are perfect has the nice comforting vibe... however I'm giving this a sub-par review, because of the customer service.

The waiter was trying to impress my friend (female) and completely messed up our order 3 times. A total of 5 of us attended that evening, and it was quite recognizable that he was not going to remember our order as he repeated our order 3 times and still didn't get the order correct. When the items finally came out, we were still missing items. The waiter should have just written the items down, instead of trying to impress everyone on his so called "memory skills."

Finally (the one that really pissed me off), I gave my card to the waiter as he wanted a card to start a tab... but my friend ended up picking up the tab for the table. He ended up charging my card and my friends card. 

I am out of town, so I tried calling the restaurant during opening hours to resolve the matter and it keeps redirecting me to some automated voicemail saying the restaurant is closed and to leave a voicemail. I still have not heard anything.


Update:
Management has contacted me through Yelp, and they have been nothing but helpful.
author: Justin R.

description: Came here for Happy Hour on a Sunday and I was impressed! I had a michelada and a torta that were both on the Happy Hour menu and both were so good. The torta was so fire that I honestly want to go back and get another one. The michelada was also perfect and refreshing. I am knocking off one star, because the service was lacking a bit and needs improvement.
author: Lindsay L.

description: One star for bartender eyeliner on fleek.  Tostadas kinda too creamy and so salty it covered up whatever naughtiness was left on them from the bathroom.   The cocktails, although vigorously shaken, tasted either too sweet (for an old fashion) or just gross for tequila based drinks.  Second star for closing us out quickly so we could get a decent drink.
author: Arthur I.

description:
Cocktails are delicious! Tacos, guacamole and the salsas are good.  Place gets packed!

Parking is tough if you are driving in otherwise take a car service. Preferably Lyft lol

Happy Hour 5pm-6pm. Small menu.
author: Joel F.

description: Came here after dinner for dranks. We ordered the 'Mucho Gusto' and a margarita. $12 and $11 respectively. They also provided us with complimentary salsa and chips which I thought tasted pretty good, not that spicy but still, pretty good. The service for this spot was great but I did come at an off-time and also, it's a bar. I appreciated that they gave us a heads-up they have to take away (alcoholic) cups after 12:00AM so we knew we had a timeline to finish our drinks and we weren't getting our drinks snatched away suddenly. Overall, got a chill buzz and thought it was a nice spot for a conversation over drinks.
author: Jan Kirby Z.

description:
Came here for happy hour a couple weeks ago. It's a rather weak happy hour menu. 

The margaritas were middling. They weren't the best but also weren't the worst. 

The self-defined "home of the pastrami taco" sounded gross. After trying it, it may have been the best item I had on the menu. 

The tamales were really good. And the tacos al pastor were also pretty good. 

I guess there's a reason they're the home of the pastrami taco. Get it if you come here!
author: Nick D.

description:
This place was pretty good overall.

I liked the atmosphere, our server, and my spicy margarita. I LOVED the two house sauces. We ordered three things but the taco al pastor is the only one I'd definitely get again. 

I tried the crickets just to expand my horizons...boring and not good. The ceviche was tasty but TINY for the cost. I think I had three small bites sharing with a friend. :(
author: Tanya W.

description:
I really had high expectation to this place. There are probably 10+ taco places in this block.  I expected this place to stand out among others.  
The atmosphere and service is good.  It has a cute cozy outdoor seating area with heaters. 
The reason I give this place one star is the food and drink  I can't say I'm an expert in tacos but these tacos are not delicious and pricy.  If they are great tacos, I wouldn't mind paying a little more.   I thought tacos are so hard to screw up because they are so simple to make and to me this place did screw it up.   Then it's their sangria.   Yet it's another simple thing to make and their sangria tastes like cherry cough syrup.  What more do I need to try?    After I ate here, I went few doors down to get a couple carne asada tacos......
author: W C.

description: The review is based on the mezcal flight, which was pretty good. The food is so-so and a bit limited. Might be better to eat dinner elsewhere and come here for after-dinner drinks. Don't get confused with the store immediately next door, Tacolicious, which shares the same entrance but has an extra glass door to enter.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
The have a big selection of Mezcals and tequilas, the mix drinks are pretty good
The tacos: well they are a single tortilla taco, good amount of meet in them, I've tried the pastrami taco and the al pastor, pastrami a bit salty, but nicely cooked, the al pastor was pretty good.
author: Ulises R.

description: Delicious happy hour margs and food at an amazing price. Everything was fresh and flavor forward. Kindof hilarious that people use this as a spot to wait for their tacolicious table, because tacolicious is very bland by comparison.
author: R D.

description: We came here looking for a bar with AC during the heat wave. The AC was great and the margaritas were delicious!
author: Kaitlyn N.

description: Drinks were okay here and food was tiny! On top of that, service was below average and it wasn't even busy. I can appreciate nice places to eat and drink but when it's actually worth the cost. Given that there are so many amazing places in the mission, I wouldn't recommend this place at all. I ordered the squash bottom quesadilla just to get a little food with my drink and I essentially paid $5 for the tiniest food I've ever seen.
author: Mallika G.

description:
+ You can order off the tacolicious menu 
+ There's typically seating here so unlike at tacolicious (which can have a 1-2 hour wait), you can sit down pretty quickly
+ Good tequila cocktails
author: Margaret R.

description: Shitty service. Only go here if you want to wait an hour for a 4 inch wide quesadilla. Only two servers for both the bar and table tops. Get a new manager or something because your obviously only in business because of tacolicious being your sister restaurant.
author: Carly S.

description: Good cocktails, good tacos and good vibes. Their pastrami tacos is better (and bigger) than the al pastor! Also try their cricket tacos!
author: Reiko P.

description:
Stefanie C. and I went out for a drink and catch up session. We found this place which seemed pretty popular and new (less than 200 reviews at the time of writing). We came early - probably around opening and there were plenty of open seats. 

I ended up getting this delicious watermelon drink - really refreshing and delicious. I'm a super fan of it - that and tequila. The place is well known for its tequila drinks as well. 

We ended up sharing a pastrami taco since we both couldn't resist the delicious smell of food. It was delicious - definitely something to get if you're in the area, great new spot in the Mission. 

Protip: get a drink and a taco!
author: Nina Y.

description:
4.5 stars. I was meeting up with Nina Y. for cocktails and a catch up session. Mosto sounded like a relatively new and hip place to visit so we tried it out. I didn't realize it was somehow associated with Tacolicious next door. We were here on an early Sunday evening, and the place was completely empty, so we seated ourselves at the bar.

I was in the mood for a spicy cocktail, so the bartender recommended the Esposas. I didn't read the menu carefully enough to see that it's basically orange juice with chile powder. Spicy screwdriver, if you will. I'm not the biggest fan of orange juice in my cocktails, so that was a fail on my part, but the drink was still very tasty.

Also, I could not resist the smell of food at Mosto. Even though I was about to go to dinner elsewhere, I read about their pastrami taco and told Nina that we were going to split one. OMG SO GOOD. Definitely going on my list of foods that one must try in San Francisco. What a genius idea!! Would highly recommend Mosto if you're looking for a new spot to hit up in the Mission.
author: Stefanie C.

description: We ordered four​ different tacos. They were just OK, nothing exceptional. We had Sangria, Michelada and margarita. Margarita​ is their speciality​ according​ to the waitress. However​, I did not find it to be special or different​ from any other Mexican restaurants. Sangria was ok, but both, Limon and Papito have better sangrias. Michelada is just not something I would ever order in any place. My friend had to return it and got the Pomegranate​ margarita instead; It was not great either. The​ service was good; The waiters were nice. Will we go back or recommend this place? Probably​ not. I think that Papito in Hayes Valley is much better.
author: Sophie N.

description:
This is a pretty cool, albeit small, tequila and mezcal bar with a nice range of drinks and a limited food menu. The Cha (mezcal el silencio, pamplemousse rose liqueur, lime, blueberries, sage) was perfectly refreshing and everything I needed in the 100 degree heat; I was less impressed with my date's Daquerita, but it was still a good cocktail. I love a small bite menu and their Botanas menu contains a nice variety of items, but the two items we tried were pretty sloppily put together; my Taco el Califa (nopales taco) was a bit bland/unseasoned (it definitely needed help from the house sauces) and while my date didn't have any complaints about his Chicharron Quesadilla, it basically looked like somebody folded a baby tortilla into a sno-cone-style cup and dumped a tiny bit of pork and cheese into it. The service was good and I'd love to give their food another shot to see if it's normally better; even if it's not, I will definitely be back for many more Chas.

I also noticed that yelp and google incorrectly listed the website for Mosto as t-licious' website, but was able to find their actual website (mostobar.com) via their Facebook page.
author: Aly P.

description:
I'm by far no tequila expert but this bar will turn me into one. Good thing I don't live in the Mission, otherwise I'll take me a week and I'd tell you everything about that devilish liquor in one single Yelp review.

Mosto is a small bar (literally) next door to Tacolicious. They managed to squeeze a bar, a kitchen corner, a couple of tables and seats, and about 1000 glasses that hang from the ceiling into one single space. It's dark in there, almost mystic, definitely intimate. Bartenders are friendly and drinks are strong. What else do you need.

Don't go there if you're hungry - while the tacos are super small and expensive ($3), the best value you'll get is probably the CHEESEBURGER ($6) which has a nice twist to it. 

Liked the burger, not the tacos. And hail to the drinks.
author: Sebastian F.

description: It's a Tuesday night. Not busy by any standards. Our server forgot our order and did not order our meals until we asked about them half an hour later.
author: Jet C.

description:
We bought a $21 per person deal ($54 with tax and tip) from Sosh.  The deal includes 3 tequila cocktails tasting and a taco.  We ate before we got there since we were just getting one taco and can't really drink on an empty stomach. We went in, told the bartender that we were with Sosh and were instantly seated at one of the bar tables against the wall.  The decor was interesting and it wasn't too loud in there.  We were promptly given the menus and a few minutes later, were given our first drink.

I thought the first two cocktails were good, but not very inspired. They almost tasted alike. I could not really discern the St. Germain from the second cocktail. My husband and I did not like the third cocktail (Tomato Salad) at all. We've both had good mezcal before (from Acme Bar in Berkeley), but have only had it neat.  The mix just did not work for us.  We ended up not finishing it. 

As for food, it was a little ridiculous.  The al pastor taco was miniscule, maybe 3 inches in diameter. Might as well charge more and make it a bit bigger.  My husband had the pastrami taco which was more expensive but it was bigger.  He liked it as he is a big pastrami fan.

Service was fine, though it would have been nicer to have had the drinks explained by the bartender/server.  I really liked not having to deal with the bill.  We've done this before using Open Table and found it to be convenient. 

All in all, we won't be back to this place.  The cocktails were not out of the ordinary except for the Tomato Salad which we did not like, and would definitely not be back for the food.  There are so many good taquerias in the area that I can't think of any reason to spend $2.50 for such a small taco.
author: Hazel C.

description: We had outdoor seating for 2. It was in an alleyway type area and had a great vibe with heating. The food was mediocre and the margarita was edible. Prices are also good.
author: Ragip U.

description:
F*ckin love this place. It's owned by tacolicious which I HATE, it's the most inauthentic hipster abomination I've ever come across. However, its saving grace is this little tequila bar with, albeit overpriced bottles and cocktails, but delicious bar food. I mostly refer to tiny cactus and cheese tacos they serve. 

Biting into one the first time was like traveling back in time to my childhood, when my parents would grill nopales and carne asada for dinner. Brought tears to my eyes. Tacos are served with three different, very delicious, very cute tiny bottles of homemade salsa. I usually end up ordering 10-15 tacos and couple margaritas. Only thing stopping me from ordering more is shame of appearing too gluttonous in front of very nice servers or my dates. That said, I do bring a lot of dates here :) The space is cozy, the staff is chill, good music always playing, and the tacos...oh, the tacos...
author: Daniel C.

description: I love this place! Great, interesting tacos-- spit roasted pork, pineapple, vegetarian tacos, huitlacoche, ceviche... delicious small bites. They also have a great list of tequila and mezcal based cocktails and a wide selection of tequila. Their bartenders are very knowledgeable about their tequila and can tell you all about it. Cute decor, the ceiling is lined with mason jars. I often bring people here who are visiting from out of town.
author: Ryan E.

description:
I love Mosto.

From the Tacolicious team, adjacent & connected to the Valencia street Tacolicious.

Tequila selection to impress even the most ardent tequila person.  The staff really know their stuff.

It's a great space.  Tiny, cool, casual & elegant; there's elegance in simplicity.  

I've been to Mosto at least 20 times.  Every time I'm there the tunes are just rockin.  You'll be using that Shazam app.

Service rocks.  Both at the bar, & at the tables.  

They do just a portion of their Tacolicious menu; but no matter.  It's ALL deeffinlicious.
Serious.

Al pastor tacos?  $1.50.  They rock, but so does everything.

Pastrami tacos?  Perfect pastrami fix.  These tacos were way better than the pastrami sandwich I had from Wise Sons.  
Serious.

The hot dog?  Fantastic.

I can't be out w friends in the mission & not at least stop by here.  I'm pretty sure that means success for any restaurant or bar...

In case the constant flow of customers was not enough of an indication.    

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
The service was good, but as it got busier the quality of the drinks declined.

We also ordered the churro and I didn't like it at all. So sad because I generally love churros.

The chocolate dip tasted like liquified cacao powder. I wish it was sweeter. We didn't eat that. The churro itself was mediocre. I guess because there was chocolate sauce they didn't really sweeten the churro. It tasted like a slightly burned cake donut. 

4 stars because our waiter was great.
author: Ghia E.

description:
Checked out Mosto last night with an old friend and was in for a good time. Mosto is a teeny little tequlia bar that is squeezed in right next door to Tacolicious (which I need to try) and is a great place for late night drinks. The place is small, dark and intimate and pretty loud, but I loved the vibe and the music. 

I had the little devil and a margarita- both delish- not too sweet or too strong. I wouldn't bring someone here for a first date or come when you're really hungry, but this is a great place to have some great drinks and enjoy the night.
author: Melissah L.

description:
A fancy bar on the mission, really nice decor, but service might be slow on a Sat night. I had the unfortunate exp of havinga very drunk bartender. I am sure he would have been a fun guy on the ither side of counter, but not when he was mixing drinks. 

It took a while to get his attention, another long while for him to take the credit card and process the situation. After 10 mins with the card, he comes back asking whether to charge me for the drink that the dude beside me had.

Then it was a pain explaining to this really drunk bartender that I was not paying for him. Not a very good exp when you try to go for a drink on Sat night.
author: Sourav C.

description: The mezcal drink had cardamon which was not my favorite. The service is painfully slow. The bartender was too busy trying to chat up some chicks at the bar and could care less about taking drink orders. Super crowded on a Friday night and a narrow bar.  We ended up getting a table and the waiter took our drink orders and then forgot them.  Painful.
author: Debbie C.

description:
Very disappointed with follow through of service.
My friend and I went to the bar while awaiting our table at Tacolicious. We each ordered one $12.50 drink. The check came and Wayne accidentally charged both of our credit cards $60.27 (quite the tip!). He reassured us that he cancelled both of the charges and that we should see a credit on our cards. My friend promptly received her credit but mine never showed. Three days later, I spoke with Hannah, who also reassured me that the charge would be credited and tends to take about 5 days. 5 days came and went and the charge was still on my card. Over the course of 2 weeks, I have left several voicemails but none were returned. The card still exists on my credit card. I understand that everyone makes mistakes but the mistake here was lack of follow through. Great drinks but one of their drinks is definitely not worth $60!!! BUYER BEWARE!!!!!
author: Erika N.

description:
Epic Torta!
After a weary day of walking ten miles and being treated as a tourist (ok, I AM a tourist, but still), I stopped in Mosto for reprieve from my general lack of mental compass. So, glad I did. It happened to be happy hour and it happened to be the best GD torta I've ever had. Three thumbs up for the amazing service, the rad drinks (try the Kai Breeze) and just what a weary traveler needed to replace the pep in her step.
author: annie p.

description: Love the vibe. The music is really upbeat. The lights are low and the cocktails are fantastic. Exactly how I like my bars. Had a hard time choosing bw the flights and the cocktails. Too many choices isn't a bad thing.
author: Emerson B.

description:
The spin-off side bar of Tacolicious.  Same building, just separated by a wall and a convenient door.  Tacolicious always intrigued me.  Gentrified tacos dead smack in the middle of the Mish.  It works, what can I say, people friggin' love it.  Me?  I have mixed feelings for it.  The plus is the atmo.  Peeps love to party and have a good time here.  Can't really do that at a legit divey taqueria down the street.

Mosto is 90% bar.  A small makeshift taco station services the bar, with maybe a half dozen offerings.  Great when indulging in their massive tequila selection, which is also featured in all of their signature cocktails.

Cocktails pretty legit but pricey.  $12 fiddy starts.  Margaritas use good tequilas but also use agave syrup and lime instead of a sweet/sour mix.  It is softer but lacks that acidic punch most associate with margaritas.  I can't stand commercial sweet/sour mixes, so this was fine for me, but not as good as Fiesta Del Mar's version where they use their "own" mix, using key limes.

La Paloma is usually a blanco mixed with Squirt and is conducive to the hot towns in Jalisco.  Here they up it with St. Germaine and grapefruit instead.  I also took sips off a chile infused cocktail and that got my brow to raise, in a good way.  Bartenders pretty good here.

Munch-wise the tacos are not bad.  At $2.50 for tiny two biters, the value can be questioned, especially in a taqueria rich neighborhood.  But in their defense, they are good.  Tortillas just barely warmed through.  You don't get the full choice of meats here, maybe only 2-3.  But what you give up in choices, you'll get fresh off the griddle freshness.  Pastor just ok, just get the one down the street for under 2 bucks.  What is hella buck here, are their Nopales con Queso tacos.  Strips of cactus on top of griddled Oaxacan cheese.  OMG good, trust.

Tamales are skipable due to the masa being overly wet/mushy.  It taste fine, especially the poblano con queso, but the masa is strange.  Their Hamburgesa however is the thing to get if a little hungrier.  It's a basic griddled burger but with Oaxacan cheese and pickled onions.  And for 8 bucks, you'll be hard pressed to find a better one out here in SF, at that price point.

All in all, not a bad spot to haphazardly stumble upon.  Clean, stylish, quaint yet solid.  I mucho recommendo.
author: D.wight L.

description: Excellent bartender! We had several super delicious margarita's while we waited for a table next door.
author: Shu Jin S.

description: I love this place, service is great, ambiance is perfect. It's small but cozy, perfect for a drink and a tapa before dinner. Our drinks were on point, tonight we had tacos al pastor and the meat was really dry. Hopefully next time is better
author: Ana O.

description: Super pricey in my opinion but I will say that the drinks were imaginative and pretty damn good.  The tapas was so so.  The mini tacos were not especially flavorful considering the price.  We would have stayed for another drink or tow but realized we didn't need to go broke our fist night in town.  This was a decent place and if you are in the neighborhood with money to burn, by all means check it out, but don't go out of your way to come here.
author: Patti M.

description: Tasty Mexican just like a local taco stand on a beach in Mexico.  Try a taco with a shaved roasted pinnacle slice on top!  Busy bar-like ambiance with trendy crowd and loud music.  Good drinks too.
author: M S.

description:
This place used to be awesome when it first opened. Bartenders tonight were terrible. If you don't want to make people drinks, don't be a bartender.

Both stars for tacos and the guy who makes them.
author: Chris D.

description:
Drinks are awesome. Ted, the bartender introduced me and my friend to Mezcal and I'm in love ever since lol. He makes good mixed drinks. I only took sips from my friend since I was busy with my tequila and mezcal flights :)
A great hangout spot with great drinks and excellent service. 
Our server was also awesome (sorry, I didn't get your name). He was very patient with us and helpful.
author: Pam Y.

description: My girl and I were in town for Valentine's Day and we're trying to find the areas where we could go bar hopping and we came across mosto's. It was a super chill vibe. There are 2 sides to the bar go to the left side where they have the guy making the al pastor tacos. My girl got the Micheladas and she's super picky and said they were good so they must be. I got a couple mixed drinks and all the bartenders were super cool. We had to come back the next day and this is definitely gonna be our spot when we are in town.
author: Jesus R.

description:
Decided to come here on a Saturday night after finding out that tacolicious had a 1 hour and half wait.. We were VERY hungry and wanted tequila & tacos right away. 

We walked in and found that the space was very small but not extremely crowded, huge plus for me. You walk in and on the right you will see tacos being made, right in front of you. Reminded me of a taco stand inside a bar, an obviously fancy version. We scouted out a table and we were able to seat ourselves after 10 minutes. The decor is interesting and very cool, there were hundreds of mason jars hanging from the ceiling and they were filled very random items.. (Including a photo of an Asian girl & a packet of Advil)

The margaritas were delicious but a little pricey ($12) and the tacos were not flavorful but luckily, you are not paying a ridiculous amount. We had the cactus taco($1.50), pork ($1.50), chorizo ($3). Personally, I didn't find any of the tacos to be delicious but they were decent. 

The service was great, would I come back? Of course, because of the service & decor
author: Natasha S.

description:
Ted and Harrison rock the bar on the weekends serving up some fine cocktails. Yes it's true, cheap mexican food and even the tacos are crafty. 

My friend had a cocktail which had absinthe. I jokingly asked for a cocktail with beet juice, and we were given one which tasted like it. 

Ted and Harrison are attentive, skilled, professional and totally approachable. 

It's a cozy bar. It is connected to a restaurant next door.
author: Leilani M.

description: Second time visiting this restaurant and I always have a good experience here! Waitresses are friendly and quick, food is delicious (5 Stars). They are also part of Tacolicious program that gives back to schools in SFUSD so every time you go there mention a school. Drinks are pretty good too. What I like most about this place is the relaxing ambient and decoration. Will deff go back soon. Brisket tacos are so Yummy, and their salsa is the best!
author: River D.

description:
Mosto, soooo delicious!

El Pastor tacos are super cheap, only $1.50! They throw some pineapple in them which add a really nice sweet touch.

Pastrami taco was more expensive, but pretty fucking MIND BLOWING not going to lie. 

Wash them all down with margaritas or mojitos and you're solid. 

Only thing that threw my friends and I off was when they gave us sauce for our tacos (yknow typical green sauce and hot sauce) they gave it to us in super small squeeze bottles. I can understand their logic to some extent, it's a small restaurant and they don't want to lug around huge bottles. However, we ordered 20 tacos and needed more sauce than just a to-go hand sanitizer bottle worth :/ 

Overall, great little place with a nice ambience as well.
author: Mars S.

description:
Low rating because of the the food. We tried five items off the limited food menu (warranted it is a bar, not restaurant), was pretty disappointing. Generally, a majority of the items were flavorless...which I didn't even think could happen with Mexican food. Lack of flavor coupled with the price made it underwhelming. Maybe an off night?

I still give two stars because for a bar, this place has a nice selection of beer and cocktails with a friendly staff.
author: Lauren N.

description: Over priced and the service is cold. Super hipster spot.  Came here with my grandma,  we spent $55 for 1 salad, 1 soup and 4 tacos. Probably not bad prices for your average techie..enjoy.
author: Terese V.

description:
So far I've been to this place twice and I like the embiance a lot.  

The have beers on tap and also have wine on tap I guess. 

It's probably right now our go to bar in the area.   

They also serve tacos which looked really good but didn't really try.   Maybe the next time we come over.  

The wait staff was friendly and we never had issues getting a seat yet.   It has been fun.    Good times made here.
author: Homer S.

description: Awesome! This place is unbelievably good, Harrison is an artist and a savant, the drinks are sensational, innovative, mind-blowing, and surprisingly affordable.
author: Mike P. A.

description:
I recently traveled to San Francisco for a work trip and some of my colleagues took me to Mosto for some mezcal after dinner. What can I say? AMAZING selection of mezcal and tequila. There were brands I've never heard of before and I drink tequila very frequently. Definitely impressed with the knowledge of the bartender and even more impressed with the wall of options. 

We didn't eat any food here, but if their kitchen is even half as good as their drinks then it's probably great!

The main reason why this review isn't 5-star was that I felt like a goldfish stuck in an aquarium with nowhere to go because it was so crowded! I know why it was crowded, but just wish it wasn't so loud so I could have a nice conversation with my colleagues.
author: Tim T.

description:
Tequila and I are NOT friends.

I don't trust him.

I think he gets a kick out of embarrassing me in public.

Friends just do NOT do that.

The first time tequila and I met, I belligerently chanted out loud (over and over again) how my friend was going to get some nookie nookie that morning...in front of the girl he just met....in front of table of 10+ people at 3 AM.

The second time at a Vegas Bachelorette party, my friend, the bride-to-be found me on the floor with two Palazzo security guards hovering over me snickering. Apparently, I was trying to get into our hotel room, gave up because I couldn't open the door so I ended up sprawled on the floor like a hobo. I think being on the right floor would have helped. FAIL. My friends now write "Please Return to Palazzo Room #" on my arm." No joke.

These days I avoid tequila like a plague. That was until hump day arrived. Looking for a post happy hour spot, Mosto was the closest place within walking distance to where we were according to my Yelp app. All I have to say is Yelp made me do it...again.

While sipping on my strong El Mosto ($9) margarita cocktail http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WMf6bHwvBftlZF-vUb6Cyw?select=9watN7YGQvcJu4XV6RT61A, we couldn't help but notice a couple next to us giggling, making out, groping and fondling each other like high schoolers in a backseat of a Chevy at the drive-thru movies. Go, Go, Get it, Get it! 

Tequila may not be my friend but it was definitely someone's BFF that night. *wink wink*

OTHER NOTES:
*Friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive staff
*Long and very narrow space (seating for ~25 people) attached to Tacolicious
*Over 300 kinds of tequila, mezcal (agave), and sotol (desert spoon plant)
*Cocktails ($9) are made with house made syrups and sodas
*Tacos ($1.50) and tamale ($3) are available for noshing
*CC's accepted with no minimum
*Parking blows
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
How many tequila shots do you need to feel tipsy? TWO! 

How many shots of tequila do you need to get the party started? FIVE! 

How many shots of tequila do you need to feel invincible?? A WHOLE BOTTLE!  ;D

I usually prefer my tequila in a margarita or plain in a shot glass with lime.  But Mosto is a place where you should do BOTH, not either.  Or you could just spend the extra $$ for a tequila flight -- 270+ tequila choices line up the wall and yes, you will have a hard time choosing so ask your bartender for recs.  We had the Fortaleza reposado and this is clearly top-quality tequila, it is spicy and rich, none of this Patron stuff.  Down that and follow it up with the housemade "sangrita" chaser or the escabeche "pickle-back" and you'll be saying: "ay carumba! una mas por favor...."

After you get the booze taken cared of, place an order for the $1.50 Al Pastor tacos. El senor will expertly carve the meat pieces off the rotating grill. He tops it off with grilled pineapple, radish and salsa. I realized that getting 4 isn't enough because they are so, so good! (but so, so TINY!)

Friday nights are packed! You'll be elbowing your way to the bar and fighting for the few coveted seats. But the drinks and bites are worth it. If you end up standing with your margarita in hand, look up at the ceiling and count the seemingly endless rows of mason jars that adorn it. There are 3000+ of 'em.

My number could be off.  You know, tequila shots and all.
author: Janice C.

description:
$1.50 tacos, and remarkably good service considering the crowd
The above is my tip, and it covers the review too!

The service (and food!) were so good, in fact, that that by itself gives this place four stars. It was super-loud, cramped, crowded and not terribly comfortable (hence the four stars) but the drinks, food, and top-notch bartenders made up for that in spades!
author: Noah H.

description: Awful service.  The waiter got our order wrong and then we waited half an hour after we asked for our check to bring for him it to our table.  The food is mediocre at best and is really overpriced.  So disappointing.  Do not go there.
author: Ghazal S.

description:
Drinks were great! Atmosphere was great! Service was horrible. Waiter took our order and said "I should write this down" he didn't and gave us a whole new order. Minus two stars. 

Interesting mystery game though as my partner doesn't  eat pork :( we asked for the check and 20 mins later we had to remind him. Again. Minus 2 stars. Geeze I really, really wanted to LOVE this place because I LOVE Tacolicious.
author: William B.

description: Love this place. The menu is inventive, the vibe is fun, the decor is cool & the drinks are AMAZING. Please try the Tomato Salad (drink)...it's such a party in your mouth! I just really enjoy the eat snacks/tapas with your delicious drinks concept and this place NAILS IT.
author: Zhenya S.

description: Bartenders were wasted, spilling food and dropping garnishes. Also rude - food is good though.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Went here while my boyfriend and I were walking around the Mission, we were on a mission to find every delicious bar and restaurant on our last night in SF. 

This place was fantastic!!!! Upon entering, it's a smaller space with a bar full of tequila and seemed a little intimidating. but the bartender and server were incredibly friendly. We ordered the paloma and two orders of the adobada tacos. The tacos were so good we had to get two orders. The meat so really well seasoned on a warm tortilla and the pineapple added the perfect sweetness. My mouth is watering just thinking about them. 

The space also has an awesome ceiling installation. thousands of jars are screwed into the ceiling, some empty and some filled. We asked the bartender what it was for and were informed that people can fill a jar with whatever they feel like. he suggested 100$ bills. lol  We didn't have any of those lying around but decided to memorialize our trip with a picture of us and a coffee card with the dates of our trip.

HIGHLY recommend checking this place out.
author: Stina L.

description:
If I were to have my last sip of tequila, it would be at Mosto (if I couldn't be on the beach in Cabo, of course). 

Mosto has every tequila imaginable and some of the best tequila cocktails I've ever had. 

Bonus points - you can get little bites at the bar or next door at Tacolicious. 

EXTRA bonus points - you can booze-up on some delicious nectar of the Gods and then mosey on over to some of the best bars in SF. Win win situ.

So, if by my glowing review this isn't already apparent, please don't come to God's castle expecting Hornitos or José. Branch out and try something new. This place will turn you into a tequila lover (if you aren't one already).
author: Amanda U.

description: When I told my friend I had never had mezcal, they immediately brought me to Mosto to hang out with Teddy (the friendliest bartender this side of the bay) and get schooled, while snacking on the most bomb hamburger I have had in a minute. Highly, highly recommend checking out this tiny hidden gem.
author: Kristin J.

description: This place makes the most amazing hamburgers with oaxaca cheese and pickled onions!! The burger is a good deal too and it's the reason why I keep coming back. I like their street tacos too. We see the same cook working the grill every time and he really has it down to an art. The setting's a little small and loud, but it's a fun place to hang out and have a drink and one of the best burgers in SF!! (special thanks to Brendan at Cervecería de Mateveza for telling us about this place)
author: Matt J.

description:
They serve tacos here with meat cooked on a spit right in front of you. YES I SAID SPIT. Wait, Ching-Yun I thought you were reviewing a bar...why is there a spit? 

Exactly. Why? Because they can. And they wanted to. Why not?!

Best. Idea. Ever. to whoever created the concept for this bar. I love it.

I was visiting SF that weekend to celebrate Yelp's 10th Anniversary and I ended up at Mosto b/c the wait at Tacolicious was too long. Maaaaaan. The tacos were priced right and were made well too. Fresh, cheap & pretty flavorful and yes, this is coming from a girl living in Mexico, I mean, San Diego, home of pretty good Mexican food.

I did not drink here, so I can't review that, but yes to a "TACO BAR!" hehe. Awesome.
author: Ching-Yun L.

description:
We originally wanted to go to tacolicious but the wait was long, so we came here for drinks. we ended up getting their burger, tacos, omg. 
SO good.
drinks were SO awesome and chiq and also food, mind blowing. i am going back here.
author: Christine K.

description:
It's only been seven weeks since I posted my review of Mosto in the Mission area of San Francisco. Seven short weeks, but in that short amount of time so much has changed that I felt obligated to write a new review to keep my readers and eaters up-to-date.

Seven weeks ago I gave this glorious restaurant a 5 paw review. I don't do that very often as to me 5 paws are saved for the best of the best. Mosto was the best of the best, but something happened and they have fallen hard.

Picture it, 5:20 p.m. on a Monday night. Not a busy time, or day of the week. I patted my furry feet into Mosto and took one of the high top tables. There were perhaps eight other people in the restaurant/bar. In other words, it was not crowded.

My order was simple, a margarita, a cactus taco, an al pastor taco, and a pastrami taco, nothing crazy or difficult. About fifteen minutes later I'm informed that another tables order was put on my bill and so they needed to sit down with me to determine what I had ordered and what on the bill wasn't mine. There were even a couple of tacos that no one seemed to have ordered on my bill. So after a round of discussions, I received the food that I had ordered.

I have to say that the pastrami taco was still as I remembered it. Nothing on my plate even resembled the wonderful food I had just a few short weeks ago. The cheese on the cactus taco was over cooked, brown, and crunchy. When I bit into the al pastor taco, my immediate thought was that the pork had been sitting out in the sun. It was completely dried out, and no flavor. We won't even go into the details of what they did to the pastrami taco.
This was without a doubt one of the worst restaurant experiences I've had in a while, not only was the service completely out of whack, but the food was total crap. Not what I expected on my return visit to Mosto. 

Alas, that will be my last trip to Mosto. I won't even give them a second chance at redemption. 

My rating...2 Paws

With love from my dog bowl to yours....Happy eating.
Shatasdogbowl.
author: DJ S.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Mosto and have been a regular here for the past 2 years preferring it to it's rambunctious and flamboyant brother Tacolicious. 

Recently I've been a bit disappointed due to the inconsistency of the quality of food. Not only have the tacos al pastor had a huge price increase from $1.50 to $2.50 (Díos mío!), they give you way less: 1 tortilla instead of 2 and a lot less meat. The taste has changed from the most authentic tacos al pastor in SF (a year ago) to typical SF fare (not Mexican). Sad cuz this was my haven for these tacos. I hope Mosto changes their recipe back. (Missing a star due to these changes)

Huge fan of their Califa tacos (nopales and cheese) and their Gringa (sausage and cheese on a flour tortilla). They also have some killer cocktails if you like tequila/mescal based ones!
author: Emily H.

description:
Cute! 4 stars for just Mosto, 5 stars for the Sosh Concierge experience.  I got a cocktail tasting and taco deal through Sosh here (and then ordered more tacos) so I got a pretty well rounded taste of the menu.

Yes: Al Pastor tacos. They are a little small and could be eaten in 2-3 bites, but the Chorizo thing was a bit bigger and quesadilla like and was also pretty good.  The house margs are tasty, and the tomato salad drink is definitely interesting, albeit good. 

No: The grapefruit cocktail is just ok, refreshing but a bit bland.

I would suggest going the Sosh route and getting a reservation- it was really cool how they just booked a table for you, and you can walk by everyone waiting.  This place is really small and narrow, so it feels intimate and fun!
author: Reyana F.

description: woooo I LOVEE TEQUILA BARS!! I got a flight of tequila shots and it's totally work it.. I was feeling good!  Also love how the bartenders pronounce all the tequila names.  I know stupid, but it makes me feel like they really know their stuff!!  Coming back for those tacos I was staring at all night though!
author: Dorothy L.

description:
Tacolicious counterpart right next door...perfect for me since tacolicious is always packed...this place is less that...but way good in so many ways!  

Taco El Pastor to start with a La Paloma to wash it down.  

Gringo De Chorizo...a bit more on the salty plus side of hats what rocks your boat.

Taco El Califa...for the vegetarian who wants a little cactus in them...not bad with their hot sauce on em...but on the bland side without the sauce...still good!!

Tamal De Rajas Y Queso...another veggie one and it's a thumbs up with some cheesy 

Ms. Reyes' Tamale...good shitz...

Pastrami Taco...o heaven goodness!!
author: Patrick C.

description: We found this place on sosh concierge, thought it would b fun to try a new spot..we were handed menus fairly quickly and once we mentioned we had prepaid with sosh..our drinks came out the bartender was on point with the timing...then the food was good but the chips with the burger was terrible. How can a burger that great have chips next to it that bad..they we over seasoned and not crispy. Drinks were good so was the food but not sure if it's worth returning...please fix the chips!!
author: Dee D.

description: Cocktails and tacos were both very good. I got the nopales taco, which is cactus. I liked it a lot, but don't get it if you don't like slimy vegetables (like okra) because that is the texture. I do wish their music was less boom/thump especially because it was still pretty early in the evening (before 7). Hard to have a conversation.
author: Lisa B.

description:
The wife found this place through Sosh. We visited Mosto last night in the early evening for cocktails and a couple of small bites. We ate dinner beforehand to be well fortified ahead of the drinking and because we knew the deal included only one taco bite per person. We were really there for the cocktail tasting. The first one was a Margarita, which was on the traditional side and not too strong but okay. The second was a Tequila that I liked and was my favorite of the three. The final cocktail was my least favorite, called Tomato Salad which included Mezcal. It was distinctive and very smoky and strong. I tried to like it and finish it but just could not. 

I really enjoyed the ambiance at this bar, since it was not overly crowded or noisy. I enjoyed the music and the vibe. The space is small and narrow but cozy. The glasses compose the low ceiling creating a cool space overhead. 

The taco I had was the Pastrami and was excellent and normal size, but the taco my wife had was extremely tiny only about one or two bites, but was fine. It was $2.50 so not too expensive, but not a great value either. We would go back for a drink again but not for the tacos.
author: Michael S.

description: The bartender from the adjacent Tacolicious makes my favorite michelada on the west coast. He was kind enough to whip one up while on the Mosto side of business and it was so good that I don't remember if I had any food to accompany it. Great place to grab a drink and quick bite with a small party.
author: Joseph V.

description: Great ambience! Randomly stopped here because it looked cool and it was awesome! Delicious drinks (we got the La Tapatia and Green Hornet) and a nopales taco and an al pastor taco. Everything was great and the service was excellent!
author: Haley P.

description:
Why I Mosto-ly Liked Mosto:

1)  Plan B if you are not interested in waiting 45 min. for tacos at Tacolicious next door.

2)  Plan A if you want margaritas and tequila.

3)  Awesome, unbelievably attentive server. 

4)  Groovy ambience with loud music, wall votive candles, and a quirky mason jars ceiling.

5)  Fabulous Mocktails

Because we had to work / fly the next day, we tried the Mia (a luscious OJ and lime concoction) and a Mexican Coke based drink ($5 each).

(Yes it's official, we're old!) 

6)  Cheap Eats 

The nopales taco and pork tacos were budget friendly ($1.50 each) but a bit bland and cold.  The tamale with chicken, green beans, and potatoes was ok flavorwise but very mushy in texture ($3).  (Next time would probably hit up El Toro instead.)

7)  M.W.A. (Menus With Attitude)

It warned us that "Getting drunk will not get you laid" and grouped the non tequila hard liquor options under "Haters."

Haters gonna hate!
author: Amy C.

description:
This place is a bit small and dark, but it has great drinks and more Tequilla than you can shake a stick at. I went with my friends and we all had top notch drinks and a great time. After a drink or two I decided to get some food and grabbed a Pastrami Taco. Yes, I know... It sounds good and it was, though I could have done without the mountains of salt.

I liked this place so much I tried to take my date there, but there is no parking within a mile of this place after work. So remember if you want to go here, take the train!
author: Robert B.

description:
This place is connected to tacolicious but I love the tacos from mosto better. The al pastor tacos are the one! So yummy I crave them all the time. 

Just a bit pricey $$$
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Ridiculous amount of tequila and knowledgable staff.

The pastrami taco is to die for.....!
author: Davinder M.

description:
For Tequila and Mezcal afficionados.  Please sip your Tequila please!

Knowledgeable bar tenders guided me to some great Blanco, Reposado, and Anejo pours.  I was astounded by the number of shots purchased by patrons that the bartenders take and remain functioning throughout the night.  I enjoy myself a good sipping tequila and this place delivers.
author: Bryan W.

description:
I was very impressed with the cocktails / small bites here!

Honestly - was not expecting much. Tacolicious next door was WAY too loud so my friend and I opted for Mosto which is right next door.

I got a tequila/pineapple/lime-y cocktail ( it's not as girly as it sounds...trust me ) Wow! it was sooo good. The perfect balance of all components and they don't jip you on the alcohol either.

We ordered tacos, tamales, a raw fish diesh and all 3 delivered. Very very yummy. Definitely more refined than Tacolicious ( and I'm a fan of Tacolicious! ).

Will definitely be back - drinks here were awesome! The wait staff was friendly and even though she was the only one on the floor, she handled everything with ease :)
author: Selina W.

description:
Darn fine margarita!  Godawful loud music!

After placing our names on the waitlist for Tacolicious, we moseyed next door to Mosto for drinkys to tide us over until our names were called

Plenty of open tables & barstools but we chose a table that happened to be near 1 of the speakers.  Had to yell into each other's ears just to be heard.....boo

Waitress was nice as could be & knew we were just waiting for a table so we were short-timers

2 Margaritas please!

Before the drinkys had been made, our table was ready & the super-nice waitress said she'd be happy to bring them over to us - awesome!

Those drinks were salty & tart & all kinds of good!  BF said he could feel the tequila after about 1/2 of his drink.....I'll have what he's having!

Browsing their menu as we were deciding on our libation, looked like they had some notable munchies & would definitely be worth a visit on their own.....getting the tacos to go from next door, of course!
author: Adrienne G.

description: Came here last night for dinner and drinks. Bartender was super rude. We didn't get service and we waited for 10 minutes. Then when we left, the couch we were sitting on broke! If someone had gotten hurt, that could have been very bad. I know my last review said I would be back again, but I won't. Too many places to try in SF with much better service and no stuck up bartenders.
author: Ashlyn R.

description: Calming ambience and extremely manageable option while waiting for a table to open up next door at Tacolicious. Of particular note are the buck fifty tacos el pastor cut from a blazing spit by the entrance. As tradition calls, this place serves with some pineapple. Best bet is to get a couple of these and some four dollar Modelo cervezas. But don't spoil your appetite as the other menu items are tempting. Then again, why not just stay here and call it a night?
author: Brian J.

description:
I absolutely love this place. Yes, it's a little too hipster for my taste but that's true about most places in the Mission. The drinks are great! I highly recommend the tequila flight. I love tequila and mezcal and what I loved about the tequila flight is that comes with different chasers. One of the chasers was really spicy and it was a perfect compliment to the tequila. 

But perhaps the greatest part about this bar is that it's right next to Tacolicious, which makes bomb tacos. You can order tacos from next door without ever having to get up from your seat! 

Order some tacos while sipping on your tequila and you'll have an unforgettable night. This place is also pretty quiet so it makes for a good date night. :)
author: Sarah E.

description:
Fun place to be on a Friday night! It's quite intimate and small (thus hard to snag a table or bar seats), but worth the margaritas and many tequila drinks! The tacos are also cheap ($1.50) and they're also conveniently located right next to Tacolicious! Bartenders were also good at their skill and attentive with our needs.

The only drawback is that it does get quite loud sometime, but hey, what bar isn't on a Friday night in the Mission?
author: Christina C.

description:
Amazing tequila selection, awesome bartenders, delicious vegetarian tacos and plantains.  Who would have thought that St. Germain would blend so beautifully with tequila?  The bartenders at Mosto figured it out and it's amazing...if those are your two fav liquors.  

The ceiling in the bar is made up of jars filled with mementos and if you are really nice to the waitress, she might let you put something in one.
author: Audra S.

description:
A family friend and I decided to meet for dinner in the Mission, quite honestly, this time last year. (Overdue! Overdue! Overdue. Thank god this isn't a library book- or I'd have some severe fees racked up.) While we had our hearts set on Tacolicious, Mosto next door was an amazing alternative. (Ok come on- they're practically the same restaurant.) 

It's really dark...and loud, but was great for catching up over good drinks and small bites. I was stoked that the bartender was familiar with the Marina menu (NOT BECAUSE ITS THE MARINA...stop judging you!) but because the Tickle Me Telmo is one of my favorite margaritas- and not featured in the Mission location. 

Totally a go to in a pinch...when Tacolicious is cray-cray...which is typically is.
author: Annalise F.

description:
This place is such a hoppin' bar!  I love the taco-making window, where you can watch each taco being made.  We had some amazing tacos with great salsas--pineapple, grilled cheese, pork--so many choices!  The prices are amazing.  It's just what you need if you're looking for a quick bite while you're roaming the mission OR if you're looking for a spot to stop, chill and have some drinks!

Also, the scene is AMAZING!  The bottles in the ceiling are genius and inspiring for all of those San Francisco artists!  The music keeps ya going too.  

I love this spot!
author: Jensyn H.

description:
Finally came by to try this hot spot located in former New College.  The place was dark and has that new, modern steelo.  Seeing the grill when I walked in was cool but you only walk by for a second.  The menu seemed limited and pricey.  
Now one of my pet peeves is wait staff who doesn't write orders down.  You know why.  You know...they always mess something up.  I even jokingly asked the guy if he was going to write it down and he arrogantly replied, "I got it."  Sure.
First dish came, double order.  Only one dish was ordered.  They just left it rather than take it back.  The waiter didn't even come back to acknowledge his mistake.  Whatever.
The fish tacos I had were bland and unexciting.  The chicharrones had some nasty flavor on them and the service was subpar.  The bill was way high for the food not be filling or tasty.
Big time let down.  Might not be around for long since they have taco competition right next door.
Parking is tough on nearby streets
author: Pablo R.

description:
While Tacolicious can be crowded, loud, and hectic, Mosto is its quiet, chill, smaller counterpart right next door. The menu is very small, but they have $1.50 Al Pastor tacos with pineapples that are super good. You can see the meat slow cooking in the window. Unlike Tacolicious' huge portion sizes, though, these are normal-sized, and I ate like 4 of them.

Good place to chill with a friend, have a drink, and eat some good tacos without having to wait too long.
author: Cynthia W.

description: get a guava mescal mixed cocktail and pastrami taco! Its a bar atmosphere with a fun crowd. A go-to spot.
author: Roberto D.

description:
$9 a shot. We aren't in Kansas anymore. But techate is 3.50... so maybe we are? Good for a date, because its a classy establishment. I liked the sexy candle-lit interior. But then again I don't really know how sexy 3.50 techate can get. 

The whole thing smelled like tacos.
author: Emily D.

description: I have gone to Mosto about four times. The last time I went was Tuesday of last week. I was gobsmacked by how I was treated. I am Hispanic, born and raised in the city, professional, etc. I totally felt a racial difference with the waitress. She took 10 mins to ask us what we wanted to drink, the table next to us had gotten there 7 mins later and right away she asked them how they were, what they would like blah blah blah. 10 mins later she comes to our table with an attitude. The food is great but the waitresses need to be nice to everyone! There was an african american girl there too and she told her to her face that she was rude and inconsiderate and left the place. Please hire nicer people, less picky with who they have to serve.
author: Judith M.

description: Love tequila? This is the place for you. There are hundreds of selections here and the menu is dizzying. Can't decide? try one of the cocktails featuring said tequila, or a few that don't and some non  alcoholics. The El Mosto classic margarita on the rocks and the Ferro's Little Devil with ginger beer are blackout good. Not since the Cadillac Bar and Grill before the Metreon took over have I had such a good one. They also do the blended styles a la Baja which are also tasty. You can have the eats over next door at Tacolicious and then continue the drinking here or you can just come here for drinks in their low lit swanky bar and back lounge area. So many tequilas, so little time
author: Kim N.

description: great place for a happy hour and quick bite to eat. the tacos are absolutely delicious! the drinks are strong and the tequila selection is awesome! service was also friendly! definitely will be back.
author: Nia R.

description:
One of the many new breed of upscale bars and restos coming to the Mission.  Hey guys, the same thing is or has already happened to Bedford Brooklyn, just sayin.

Still having an El Mosto will definitely put you in a good mood.  The second one will do even better!  Delicious tequilla cocktails, to warmup our pre burn.  Sweet!
author: Sean S.

description: Zane was an amazing host. He remembered the authentic drink he made for me a few months back and it was special. Glad I invited my friends from Sj to join me. Props!
author: Pat R.

description:
3.5. It may come as a shock to most but I can't (and don't) eat/drink all the time. Well, let me rephrase: I can't (and don't) eat fatty food/drink booze all the time. There. Fixed. In my youth of board shorts, obliques and laughing in the face of age (not to mention running and a decent gym ethic), I ate and drank with reckless abandon and dared the universe to stop me.

Then I hit a certain age. Father Time, Mother Nature ain't got nothin' on you when it comes to being a [redacted]. For this reason, we thank the mocktail menu at Mosto. Yes, it's not as sexy as tossing back some craft cocktail and making cross-eyed googlies at the fine young thing in the painted-on jeans but after a while, a man gets tired of living that way. And as sung in 'The Lion King', the circle of life demands a return to that which was awesome as a child: grenadine. Yep, the stuff that Shirley Temples are made of are back and they're still delicious. I ordered the Moss Mocktail. It's a potent combo of Mexican Coke, lime and grenadine. Sounds simple. Tastes delicious. If the thought of one more ounce of poison floating through your liver makes you queasy, settle in for an expertly made craft mocktail, cool environment/vibe and decent playlist. Oh, and service. Attentive service that feels authentic is another reason to stop in... but first and foremost, get a mocktail. And call your mother. You never call.
author: Johnny T.

description:
for a place that tries to corner the latino side in the mission ---- it's a miss.

the prices are high, the waitresses are not helpful, the food is half ass, the cocktails are ok--- over priced.
author: Princess P.

description:
My friend's father challenged him to a tequila vs. mezcal identification, so Mosto was the perfect place to go taste-testing.  They have a full menu of both, and while I don't know the first thing about either (I tend to select an alcoholic beverage based on a) color and b) price by the glass), it's a really fun place.

It's a small and narrow place, so if you can, go earlier in the evening--or on a weekday--to ensure a seat or space at the bar.  We showed up at about 6pm and had a table to ourselves for tasting and card-playing.  Waitress was super-friendly and indulged our experimentation.  As a bonus, you can get decent-sized mexican food for only $1.50 per portion!  Fun place to stop for drinks before or after dinner.

P.S.  Tequila won over mezcal, hands down.
author: Joëlle M.

description: This is a true hidden Gem. It'd dark and hip. The food is simple street tacos and nibbles. The cocktails were a little complex in my opinion. I had a pink sweet margarita which I can't even remember the name of. It was tiny:( My husband had one that was so spicy he could barely finish it. They were also expensive. But be assured I will return. The pork tacos with pineapple were amazing. I would probably get a simple drink next time or even a beer!
author: Melody M.

description: The space is a little tight, so if you don't mind being in small spaces with strangers, the drinks were not too shabby, and the Al Pastor tacos at $1.50 were delicious and kept the hunger at bay until a late dinner, especially after a few cocktails!
author: Christina L.

description: Great bar. Great music. Ted the bartender is the best! It is small and crowded but fun. I got a whiskey shot for having a good personality. Nuff said!! Don't argue with amN that recognizes genius!
author: Marium M.

description: My man Ted made the experience, he is a legit mixologist.  I consider myself well traveled, and I had arguably the best margarita ever with the Cimmarron tequila!   I just moved to town and I will be a regular!
author: Brian G.

description:
T-Lish on the right side had some killer guacamole.  The salsa was sweet and smokey and on the house and came with some thick, crunchy, restaurant style tortilla chips.  I think they were house made because they were warm.  My boyfriend described the michilada as one of the better ones that he's ever had.  My coconut water-pineapple cocktail was ok.

The mural of the cityscape on the outside patio was cool.
author: Elise G.

description: I don't even know what to say. Came here on a whim. Overpriced. Overrated. I wasn't white enough for this place. I make better tacos and service mediocre.
author: Guadalupe P.

description:
Thank goodness for those pork tacos that cured my hanger at only $1.50 each. Seeing the cook slice the meat from the rotating meat stick thing (as often seem with shawarma) added at least 10 tasty points. 

We took the corner booth next to the tv to watch the Cal vs. Stanfurd game and enjoyed excellent service. Our waitress was not only attentive, but also patient. Very, very patient.

Even though I'm not the biggest fan of Mexican food, I'd definitely be open to trying out the restaurant side of Mosto. From what I saw on the way to the (clean) restrooms, the other side looked classy and quaint. Especially the outdoor area with the mosaic/mural-y decor.
author: Olivia W.

description: Very cool bar. Amazing tequila drinks. It was weird though, my date and I tried to pay for the drinks and the bartender ignored us. Maybe he was too busy. But it was strange. We ended up at a table and asked the waitress for the check which apparently was available. Weird experience,  great drinks, quaint bar. I would drink there on payday.
author: Emily G.

description:
The drinks are perfectly crafted with all fresh ingredients. It's a little pricey but well worth it! Try the house margaritas -- they're super refreshing!! 

Definitely one of my favorite bars in the area, as it is perfectly located in the heart of the Mission. Great spot to start your night off and jump to a nearby restaurant for some grinds.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I've never been treated so rudely or disrespectfully in my life. The red-head bartender with the pony tail working on the evening of 5/5/16 was an absolute a-hole. He asked for my ID and when I went to pull it out, he told me to "lighten up, lighten the f*** up". From the time I ordered my drink to finishing my drink (30 min or so) we saw him take four shots. He was obviously inebriated while working and was completely vile. This experience was absolutely awful and I will never come back here.
author: Annie D.

description: Nice place to grab a cocktail or two with some tacos on the side.
author: Sheila T.

description:
Tequila. Have I ever had a problem with you? No. 
Will I now? Possibly, thanks to the addition of Mosto to the Mission. 

Unfortunately, I apparently arrived on the later end of the night (their liquor license currently ends at 12 but they're trying for an extension) but with enough time to order the classic Mosto margarita and a few tacos.

They don't currently offer flights of tequila (a shame with the selection they have), but the waitress was willing to put one together for us. We just ran out of time. 

Sat next to the owner who was keeping a good eye on everything but who definitely doesn't look like the owner of other Mission bars... for instance the new Dear Mom.

It's a little ironic, this whole Tacolicious / Mosto thing in the middle of the Mission. Why wouldn't I just go get tacos from a Mexican down the street? Definitely contributing to the Marina-fication of the Mission. Will be interesting to see how this "chain" does.
author: A S.

description: Went on a Sunday night.  The place was packed.  The cool Sunday evening vibe has been ruined.
author: Needles K.

description:
tacolicious! yummy trio tacos... 
we had the pork ribs and steak tacos.. so mouth watering and the salsa hit the spot. 4 tacos for $14
author: Linda B.

description:
I can't comment on price range, because I just assume that every meal I have in San Francisco is going to be 2x as much as Portland. My math on that may be a little skewed. 

But you know what? Plug this into your spreadsheet:

       |- - - - A  - - - - | - - - B - - - | - - C - - |
- 1 -| - - FOOD - - | - - Yes! - - | - - 1 - - |
- 2 -| - - DRINK -  | - - Yes! - - | - - 1 - - |
- 3 -| - -SPACE- - | - - Yes! - - | - - 1 - - |
- 4 -|  -SERVICE  | - - Yes! - - | - - 1 - - |

Column C logic:
=IF($B:$B="Yes!",1,0)

IF Statement Formula:
=IF((SUM(C1:C4)[less than]4),"Meh.","WOOHOO!")

Result: "WOOHOO!"

Notes:
(1) House-made chips and salsa and flavorful fancy cuisine.
(2) Unusual, memorable, and dare I say savory? cocktails.
(3) Comfortable, clean and quaint environment.
(4) Fast, friendly service, even when you're in a rush and need to catch a plane.

---
If you prefer a simpler equation:
 MOSTO = GRANDIOSO.
author: Katrina W.

description: Drinks were v good. BUT the tacos were not. Al Pastor taco was v dry and had no spice. Nopales taco was v bland. Pastrami taco wss good.
author: Ananya P.

description:
Mosto is a chill spot for a tequila cocktail and some small bites.

I am a fan of the pineapple on the 1.50 taco al pastor, but I'd like either a more tender pork or more pineapples. The tamale was light with fresh ingredients (ended up ordering another round) and the pastrami taco was surprisingly tasty - not too heavy at all. 

Super friendly service.
author: Vina A.

description: I love this place drinks are yummy and  the food is amazing better than tacolicious and the ambiance is  good depending on the night. Only problem is too small and no bathrooms ! Other than that I highly recommend it !
author: Jeannette K.

description: Top notch. Get the pastrami taco. The people and crowd who are here make this one of my favorite spots. I ledft a guitar pick in a jar in the ceiling.Great people,great food and tequila. $40 and my friend and I got loaded
author: Gabriel C.

description:
Indulge in a Mezcal flight here! There are separate bar, dining and outdoor seating areas. The dining area is intimate yet spacious. The salsa and chips are extremely good so you might forget to leave room for the meal but please do - the bites are tasty. 

The biggest obstacle you'll encounter here on your journey to happiness is the crowd. It gets thick and heavy and very loud so if you're planning a more intimate evening get savvy about when you're arriving or keep the group small.
author: Lily C.

description:
We showed up late on a Saturday night after they'd stopped serving alcohol but the food was outstanding!

Try the taco sampler. So many delicious choices.

Bonus: One of the servers looks really similar to Aubrey Plaza! Conversation starter.
author: Stephen C.

description:
I'll admit, I was entertained for the first 5 minutes inside Mosto.  Ambiance, check.  Clever lighting scheme, sure.  Tall tables so people can sit/stand, yup. 

Things got disappointing fast when we tried to get drinks from the bar.  I'm fine waiting to order, but am less fine with the bartender rolling his eyes and then having an extensive conversation with the two people who were eating at the bar next to me.  He took no action on making the cocktails or pouring the beer.  Just stood there chatting.  I stood there watching and, incidentally, learning more about those people than I wanted to know.  Thinking that I had committed some social faux pas, my fellow drinker ordered the next round from the bar on the other side.  Same thing.  Order got taken and then the bartender seemed to get distracting in the middle of the transaction.  

Maybe service was just slow?  Apparently not once you get your drink!  My friend put her drink, 90% full, on the bar that runs along the front window.  She turned her back (but did not step away) to finish telling a story. In less than a minute, an employee nabbed the drink off the bar and was speed walking away with it.  This could have been an honest mistake, but the employee then proceeded to upbraid my friend about not putting her drink down unless she was done with it.  Really?  Maybe this would be okay if we were wasted, but it was our first drink of the evening. 

Paying that much for a cocktail, you shouldn't have to fight the staff in order to get it or finish it.  Thanks, Mosto, for making it so easy for me to never come back here again.
author: Laureli K.

description:
Yes, yes, yes!!!

Great spot!!!  All kinds of different tequilas if you like it... delicious tapas, delicious drinks, awesome atmosphere! 
Been there twice, and I'm sure ill keep going. 

Tapas are super good, I tried 3 and liked all of them.
My drinks were very well done too, and the service is pretty good, so really nothing to complain. 
Oh, if you wanna go on a date, might be a good spot for it, since is charming and a little dark. 

Thumbs up up up to Mosto! :)
author: Paula C.

description: Great place for a taco snack and drink while you're waiting an hour for a table at Tacolicious. Try the pastrami taco but don't watch the cook at the little window make it or you'll feel guilty for consuming all that delish fat.
author: Nicole O.

description:
Came to this bar with my friends since Tacolicious next door had an hour wait, and I'm glad we did!  Love the tequila selection and the page long mezcals!  

Had a mezcal flight for $20, the bartender chooses 3 for you.  The Al Pastor tacos were good.  Definitely coming back to try more tequilas and other items on the menu!
author: Alice W.

description: Pre Tacolicious, this is here everyone goes. Probably because you write your name down at tacolicious and then tell you there's an hour wait.
author: Dimple B.

description:
Had some dinner down the street and wandered in for some tequila on a chilly Wednesday.  Nice spot, with a dark long bar on the left and an open woody seating area to eat on the right.

Asked the bartender to make us things based on our likes and he came up strong.  Had a great mezcal drink which was sweet and smoky.  

At $12 a drink it ain't cheap, but it's SF so what you gonna do?

Crowd was kinda date nightish with not many singles.
author: Jay L.

description: Happened to come by accident. Heard of the bar by word of mouth earlier. Pleasantly surprised. Very light and airy. Serves my favorite Tequila. The "Real" Patron Siete Leguas. For those Tequila Aficionados. Siete Leguas was the Tequila in the Patron bottle until recently. Now it's just a blend of other Tequilas. Mixed drinks were done nicely I think the bartenders name was Jacob. Real nice guy. Anyway. ambiance is low key, but energetic at the same time. The food plates are good.
