Had the Posole, Ceviche, Camarones al Diablo and the Chilaquiles. All great for feeding the hunger pain. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. If I'm in the area, I will drop in again.
author: J G.

description:
Mosto rocks!!! Best selection of tequila and margaritas to match in SF. Awesome music, great scene, great bartenders. Love this place!!!! 

I'm not rating the food as we just drank and hung out, but everything I saw looked pretty amazing!
author: Braden B.

description: Excellent drinks, you have a different menu and you can get the same stuff they sell next door at tacolicious. The owners are excellent, and the staff is fantastic. I will be back for sure.
author: Jonah K.

description:
Came to Mosto on NYE..food was delish..service was awesome and margaritas were a hit!  I am definitely a fan of Mosto and will be back.

El Pastor tacos with the pineapple got me..best I've had in SF.
author: Erica R.

description:
Bright sun in the Mission. Strolling south on Valencia. Obviously in the mood for Latin fare--I call it love, others call it a disease. 

My partner and I happen upon Mosto--instantaneous curb appeal: gaping plate glass windows and simple, inviting gray-green earthen facade. Friendly greeting by the hostess, immediately seated at a two-top in the sun. Ambiance perfect so far--expansive mural with scrawled messages opposite us, wooden floorboards, lights strung above. So far, excellent. 

Cute female hipster servers all about, but none come to our table right away...or within our first 5 minutes of being seated. Minus a few points. Finally, a busboy brings us water, chips and salsa. The chips house-made chips are salty, crunch and fresh. The salsa amazes us--light brown-orange, not your everyday pico- or tomatillo-style offerings.  Slight tang and spice complement the chips well. Points regained.

When our server finally arrives we decide on a pitcher of red sangria--a drink we both adore--for $26, which is standard for trendy Hispanic places. Another 5 minutes or so elapses before it arrives, served in a 1 liter carafe. Most of the volume is ice, which is disappointing. The disappointment deepens when the sangria tastes like watered-down kool aid, with barely any alcohol burn or spice notes. Big minus here. $3 Tecate cans are not bad, but I would like to see 21st Amendment cans for $3 or $4--something that is probably not fiscally appropriate in the Mission. Oh well!

We decide on the tilapia and shrimp ceviche. For $13, the portion is smallish. I think the chef was going for something audacious and interesting, but failed: the dish has nectarines, which is nice, but they are muted by the lime. In fact, the prevailing flavor is not of the seafood nor the nuances of the fruit and vegetable combination, but of the lime juice. The dearth of flavor is definitely not worth the money.

The decor and vibe of this place is decidedly rad if you enjoy the upscale, hip Mexican scene, which both of us certainly do; however, our experience with the food, albeit small, is a major turn off. Would I return? Probably, if only to hang at the bar or outside with some beer.
author: Justin M.

description:
This place is a party and you are invited!

Even if the food were bad, which it is not, just watching the employees is a show.

They either over-staff everyone, or everyone works off the clock to keep on chilling. I saw a waiter give someone a kiss, the guys in the kitchen would not stop laughing, the host was jumping all over the place, everyone had smiles on their face...well, I just felt so welcome. I love it when the kitchen kids look so radiant.

Who cares what you should order, pick randomly, everything is good. Not super expensive either. Not that there is something overly particular about chips, but I really like their chips.

Anyway, keep the great vibe.
author: Alexia R.

description: Great mezcal selection. Lousy tacos.
author: Mattie P.

description: I write a lot of 5 star reviews and I really hate to write a 1 star review, but on occasion it's warranted. I suggested the server just put our appetizers in because our dinner order would be a lengthy one. She gave me a condescending look and said she would be fine without writing anything down. Well what do you know, she forgot 2 things on our order as well as an entire round of drinks later in the evening. Then didn't feel sorry apparently after I let her know. Will not be back :(
author: Kyle D.

description:
After college, I thought I'd never be able to smell tequila again, let alone sip it. Turns out I just needed to find some of the good stuff. Thanks to Mosto for showing me the way... olé!

The tequila menu here will make your head spin with excitement. After reading all of the colorful and complex flavor notes listed, I want to try them all. At around $10 a swig though, I'll have to take my time. The flights are fun, but of all the tequilas I've tried here so far, my favorite is the Espolón blanco. To my surprise, it's not very expensive in stores (~$20), so I am excited to stock the ol' wet bar with it. Get ready: one tequila, two tequila, three tequila, floor!

The itty bitty, street-style tacos are much different than the ones served on the Tacolicious restaurant side, but just as t-lish. Though I would happily eat one million of both the bistec and cactus (with burnt cheese!), I usually settle for just a few. Each one is intended to be a bar snack, not a meal - but they will save your life as you're wasting away waiting for a table next door.

As seems to be the case for most Mission bars these days though, this place is shoulder-to-shoulder CROWDED on the weekends (primarily popped-collared and/or sloppily drunk in stilettos types), so don't even try on a Friday or Saturday night.
author: Stephanie P.

description: The service was great, but the food was awful. The two stars are for the great waitress.
author: Jen S.

description:
AMAZING. Enough said. Best place for tacos and drinks. You'll get your money's worth.

I had two of the fried local rock cod cabbage, with tangy crema which was divine! Not too much fried and it was so light. It was so good it literally melted in my mouth, no joke. I also had two of the guajillo braised beef short rib which was really juicy and moist. All of the tacos were delicious, but I will say they are filling. Remember that they come with two tortillas and you can make four tacos out of two.

I don't like tequilla, but I had the best drink there called flor de Jamaica. It was delicious and EFFECTIVE. Even their guacamole is delicious, but its a little over priced.  

Service is great, and people are friendly. The way wait can take a while, particulalry at night, so I would suggest eating there in the afternoon.

OVERALL great place and one of my favorites!
author: Mara M.

description: Hip and trendy scene... we sat in the bar section and munched on their tacos.  Was a good experience... just a bit too crowded for comfort.  Probably not a great idea to come here if you hate tequila.
author: MJ A.

description:
Composed tacos and inspired pitchers of margaritas!

I've been there a few times in the past year, and I will continue to patronize these guys. I've sampled all the tacos, the guacamole, and a smattering of the offer drinks, and it doesn't seem like you can go wrong with any of the choice. This is why it's popular, but I've lucked out and been able to get seated midday on a weekend as I walked in the door. The bartenders and staff are willing to engage and the availability of outdoor seating is a huge attraction! 

Pluses: food, drinks, prices, location, space, staff
Downs: popularity, and the noise level (sometimes)
author: Basil B.

description: I've never been to this place and was a little nervous because of the huge tequila list, but the second we got in this guy named Carlos sat us and was friendly as hell and made us feel like regulars.  I was completely confused by the list and didn't know where to start and we asked for some help, not only was he patient with us, but he picked out the best tequila for us and brought some red drink to sip on after shots. He was hospitable and respective and quite frankly hot, (but don't let my husband know). I was not disappointed and will be coming back in the hopes that Carlos will serve our group exquisite tequila.
author: Captain Muffin D.

description: Great great cocktails. Luv the idea of separate menus for the bar area to restaurant area which pretty much doubled my options for food n drinks to try. The ambiance is pretty phenomenal as well. Totally chill SF peeps all the way. Went to dinner without reservations but it worked out well cuz of the bar area. Ate a little and drank a little... just enough to make it to dinner and have a blast a little. Guess I had a good time :)
author: Sue T.

description:
This is a sexy place with a great floor plan. The left is the bar/lounge area and the right is the sit down restaurant. The bar patrons don't hover over the diners and dinner service doesn't interfere with the liquid dieters. 

A great tequila menu with some excellent bottles and an even more solid selection of main wall tequilas which goes beyond the sub-par Patron. Friendly bar staff and helpful wait staff made the crowded bar area comfortable. 

Nice work guys....I will be back to try the food and enjoy more amazing tequilas. 

Cocktail of choice: La Paloma
author: Jay H.

description: Sublime tequila and mezcal bar with great service and an impressive selection of libations. Well informed and hyper friendly bar tenders make sure that your drinking needs are taken care of. Like a Las Vegas casino, or unlike one, it's always dark inside, making you think that it's a perfect time to sip on a good tequila. Even if it's only 3 PM on a Wednesday!
author: Ashwin M.

description: Cute place. Good drinks, al pastor tacos were really good, small but good. Parking was killer but then again it always is in the city. Tab was about $45 for 3 drinks and 4 tacos. Not Bad.
author: Betty R.

description: Big big fan. Dark and loud. needs more bar snacks. Yum
author: Alyssa K.

description:
Probably the best gringo tacos I've ever had. Met up with Randy, Char, Elisa, and A.Lau while coincidentally running into Cat and Jor and their families.

7 dollars for a tequila shot and a tecate? Done deal, especially for a tough day of work  (all of us were having)

We ordered the 10 tacos special for 31 bucks. 3.10 a taco is pretty pricey for the Mission, but this is more of a fusion place. All tacos come with 3 sauces... spicy (habanero), medium (tamarind i think), and mild (green sauce). All sauces were good, and had different profiles so mix and match.

Short Ribs - these were cooked medium, and were super tender but you'd pretty much gobble up all the meat before even finishing the taco. The only thing that was bad about these were that they were under seasoned.

Carnitas - Surprisingly tender... closer to pulled pork though than carnitas. Not overly salty or crunchy, which was a bit disappointing, but the pulled pork flavor was great.

Beer/Tequila Chicken - amazingly flavorful. Almost like a mole taste to the beer/tequila chicken, but it had this nice sweetness from the beer and tequila. The chicken was ultra tender, and not overly salty.

Fish - this gives Nick's a run for its money. While this may be smaller, it is slightly cheaper than Nick's. It has a better batter flavor as well, though Nick's bests Mosto's with the guac and crispy tortilla. 

Lengua - not one of the specials... but still amazing. Ultra tender cubes of beef tongue (don't worry, they shave off the taste buds), marinated so that it was slightly sweet but more salty. This was amazingly tender, as in yakitori japanese restaurant tender. You cannot get tongue cooked any better than Japanese style or Mosto style. My only gripe was the price tag (5 bucks). However, this is THE BEST lengua taco I've ever had... hands down... sadly its a weekly item only.

Choco Taco - pretty much a fancy choco taco... with the waffle being crispy and flavored similar to a Swedish pancake (vanilla flavored). The ice cream was deliciously creamy and dense (vanilla flavored as well) and the chocolate was dark chocolate. Almost tasted like a fancy Drumstick.

Overall an awesome place, with good deals. I would dock it 1 point for bringing tacos to the Mission but this place is different than your standard tacqueria. As many others have said, it does have a sexy atmosphere, and I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Marc T.

description:
Really bad drinks, that's all.

Great atmosphere, nice location, OK bar food, but bad drinks. (And pretty terrible service, too, if I'm honest). 

My friends and I went here and sampled 6 different tequila drinks, and not one of them was good. One was way too sweet, one was really just stupidly spicy, one was way too acidic, etc. The three of us couldn't make it through a single one of their drinks, so we ended up ordering the plain-old-margarita as a control/last resort, and it too sucked and just tasted like sours mix, not lime. 

I'm being a tad vindictive with the stars here, but frankly if the place identifies itself as a tequila bar and makes such godawful tequila drinks, it deserves it.
author: Sasha K.

description:
The happy hour tacos and tequila selection are both top notch. 

Love this place and can't wait to return for dinner.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Huge fan of mosto! The passion shot with chili infused tequila and passion fruit juice starts off fruity and finishes with a great kick of heat. Granted I have only been to drink, however I can't wait to go back for food. 

Sexy establishment... Incredibly well designed.

Luv!
author: SF U.

description:
Finally got to try this place - yummy food and a cozy environment. neat lights and modern decor that has a homey edge to it.

Got a cocktail that had a few things in it and it was very tasty - sorry but i can't remember the name and it's not because i had too much to drink!

we got the nopales taco - very small but full of flavor. Also the tuna plate which is only 4 small small pieces for $6 so be aware that's it's not a very inexpensive place but the quality is worth it.

the smells from the food next door are very very tempting so I look forward to trying that.

one suggestion - chips and salsa would be a nice addition to the bar menu!
author: ari s.

description:
This place is amazing. Pioneering tequila and tacos in the mission (ignore their marina location!). The staff know their sheisse and the food is top notch. 

New mission hotspot no doubt.
author: Tyler M.

description:
I'll definitely come back for the food. The wall menu showed excellent deals, as laid out below, and they offer it until midnight when the liquor license also expires.

You'll find a fantastic list of tequilas, and yet most of the people there were drinking beer or mixed drinks. I'm looking at you, guys, learn how to drink your liquor, and drink it  neat....

The music went from loud to comically loud. I couldn't help but laugh, and the bass was nearly breaking up. Thought it was still at least 30min before last call.

Love the setup of the place: stools and small tables, with a high booth on one side and standing option on the other. Great feel for a small space. 

Mejor tarde que nincun...better late than never. That would describe our server who was really enjoying spending time with another server and occasionally forgot about us. Regardless she wasn't just kind, but enthusiastic about sharing her love of tequila and letting my friend, who'd sworn it off since college, find one that was palatable.
author: Mike H.

description: quality drinks, knowledgeable staff, and vast selection. Let your bartender guide you through the extensive tequila list, complete with detailed flavor notes. The choices are every bit as nuanced as a wine list would be. And order food while you are here, the kitchen is top notch.
author: Mark N.

description:
Man, if I lived in the area this would totally be one of my regular spots. The ambiance of this place is great, really love the layout and the overall vibe from the decor to the lighting to the service.

I was in San Jose with a co-worker on business and on our last night we decided to drive over to SF and grab some drinks. Luckily I found this place on Yelp and I'm so glad we checked it out. The tacos I had were really great and the Long Island I ordered was perfect. 

This is going to be one of the first places I stop at when I'm back in the SF area, for sure!
author: Ara A.

description:
I love a late night lounge...I love bottles all over the ceiling...I love a menu with happy hour prices all day....Mosto is the know-it-all of tequila, I have yet to see a more expansive selection of tequila. I recommend the flight to get you started, four or five nice pours gives you a little taste of everything. 

The cactus taco here is a little gem...At a buck fifty its a tasty little snack that will soften the tequila buzz that's about to hit ya hard. Hot sauce is an obsession of mine, and Mosto hooks it up with two very well made sauces to garnish your small bites.
author: Jocelyn B.

description: We've been here more than once, with greater frequency, and love the cozy space with delicious drinks, food and waitress! Hard to say which taco or tamale is the best... You'll just have to sample one of each. That's the fun of it! Take the leftovers home - even better the next day! Powerful cocktail list that is updated often.  Very unpretentious, unlike its cousin next door (Tacolicious).
author: Brian P.

description: Wonderful addition to the hood. Great margs. Great limited bites menu! Great service.
author: Andrew K.

description: One of the coolest spots in the Mission.  They have an exceptional selection of Mezcal and Tequila.  It wouldn't be right to go and not order the al pastor tacos.  Make sure you do that!  The staff is super chill and can help you get the right drink.  Oh and look up at the ceiling, it's fun, trust me.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I'm confused if Mosto and T-Lish are the same place, i think they are just t-lish is the restaurant side. Regardless, I can't stop eating their chips and amazing salsa. The tacos are my favorite and I have never tried anything else there, mostly because I LOVE THE BISTEC TACO. I think i've tried all of them now and their each delicious. 

If you like a full bar (i do), gourmet mexican cuisine (i do) and a lively environment you'll love it here. 

my boyfriend LOVES their flights of tequila, if that's you're drink you'll love their selection.
author: Caitlin F.

description:
Best bloody mary I have had in ages... Their house mix is so savory and spicy and yummy and like nothing I have ever tasted before... plus! pickled carrots and jalapeños as the garnish. I am in love.

As for food, I only had one short rib taco, but it arrived with a huge basket of lovely tortillas, a bowl of savory, medium spice salsa, and a trio of specific salsas for the taco ranging from a mild. green to a thin, gorgeous spicy-hot habanero.

I will go back again for brunch sometime soon and I look forward to sitting outside in their little side patio.
author: Brandi V.

description: Limited seating but what they lack in chairs they make up in tasty cocktails. I enjoy the vibe. Good energy, happy servers and interesting decor. Just stopped in while waiting for my table at Tacolicious and want to return now to try the food. Stay-tuned for that report.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Good drinks, they aren't stingy on the alcohol. I also ordered the pork skins and ate them with lime and hot sauce as recommended by the server. They were cool, and kind of melt in your mouth (which I didn't really like). 

I was disappointed that I couldn't order chips and guacamole, you can only order that at their sister restaurant in the next room.
author: T S.

description:
first thing to do when you enter is look up... their ceiling is covered w mason jars!!! i think its a cool thing! 

went there on a sunday night and of course they were pack. they have ten million tequilas and they are all displayed on the front bar. its def a place for tequila lovers!
author: Cathy B.

description:
Mosto/Tacolicious, I love your tiles! Yes, because of those nice old Spanish tiles you have in the main dining room, oh.. and the Paul Madonna's ink drawing of Delores Park, you got bump up from 4 to 5 stars.

Food: the appetizer are very generous in size, tacos are very large, two will be enough to fill me up, I don't think I can ever eat more than 3 in one sitting. The grilled squid Veracruz are so soft and juicy; the chicken enchilada are pretty good as well. The chip and salsa that they provided are good, the chips are thin which you can just nibble on all night long. 

Drinks: Oh.. they have tequila. In fact, the tequila list is bigger than the food menu. I still think Tres Agave has a more comprehensive tequila list, still with just about 100 type of tequila on their list, they gave me another excuse to come down to Mission. Their margaritas are very good, not too sour, definitely recommended. $10 per cocktails and $30 for a small pitch of the same cocktails, as you can see, drinks are not cheap here, and it is where they will make their profit.

Decor: modest, comfortable. The only thing I didn't like is those metal stools. They have a few different spaces. As you come into the main dinning room through the courtyard space, you will see a small bar counter with a much larger open kitchen, high bench sitting along the glass window that open to the courtyard. There is a banquet room pass the bathrooms, and another parallel space to the main room that have a much better bar setup. I like the variety that it provides, also it just means the wait time is less. (I hope)

Service: Overall good. Food came really fast, and our drinks took a little while.

Just a couple of suggestions, if tequila will the be the premier alcohol, then maybe the wait staffs should be better trained about them. I asked for sangrita to come with my Herradura reposado, and our waitress didn't know what the heck I am talking about. Also the few tables next to the hostess has the most awkward set up, those short metal stools look so uncomfortable. They could easily do a couple of large communal table with bench seating.

By no mean, this is not a place that their food or drinks will blow your mind away, but they do have a winning combination of being well priced and exactly what I have in mind for a night out in the Mission.

Great new addition to the Mission casual fine dining scene.
author: Alice C.

description:
I was skeptical about this "Mexican" bar venue in my hood, but it was way better than expectations.  Great service, cool design, and fantastic tacos / bar bites.

Cocktails were good, great tequila selection.

A new neighborhood favorite!  Small space, lots of people, but worth a bit of a fight to the bad for the drinks
author: Java Z.

description:
Many things to LOVE about Mosto

-Taco, Beer and Tequila shot combo for $10
-Great decor with a cool alley patio
-Normally I like carnita or beef tacos but at Mosto the fried fish taco and chicken taco....Bravo.
-Great staff

It gets packed pretty quickly so get there early!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Went there with a group of friends as a belated birthday celebration for myself and instantly became a fan of Mosto.  Ordered the tickle me telmo (so good) and tacos (classic carnitas, beer and a shot chicken and forgot the last one) and both were very good.  Would come back again.  
They don't do birthday celebrations but you can order a dessert and they will bring it with a candle to your table :)
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Honestly, other than the adorable babies sitting adjacent my partner and I (who were diversified enough to be in a Gap commercial) my experience here was subpar. We chose to sit outside which on some aesthetic level was interesting with its softly etched mural of San Francisco including bits of inspiring and fragmented prose, long narrow channel flooded with cheap-looking, yet fun modern orange seats tucked under some industrial string lights. Let me belabor the point, that was the best part. 

It took us a while to get greeted. The sangria was a glorified watered down icee with only enough alcohol to laugh at one of my partner's jokes (not okay). We split the ceviche which was just okay. It was bland with no complexity, the bits of nectarine added nothing-- it was overpowered by a wash of  lime juice. The chips and salsa were surprisingly the best part. The chips were perfectly salted and fresh with a golden hue that reminds me of the dried grass on Mt. Tamalpias. The salsa was fresh, tangy and had no chance in hell of staying full.

The food was overpriced for the quality and the service was slow. They did have a pretty nice tequila list-- expensive but good. So my suggestion would be come get a nice shot of tequila and eat some free chips and salsa.
author: Brienne P.

description: Love this place.  Tacolicious minus the attitude.  The pastrami taco is out of this world, and their standard margarita is the best I've had in the city.
author: Stephanie S.

description: This place is perfect if you're looking for a nice tequila fix. Their margaritas are bomb, especially if you like it spicy. They literally have every tequila you could come up with, its quite impressive. Their staff is super friendly and the environment is comfortable.They show the football games, which is a plus if you're into sports. It gets a little tight if they're busy but its great if you're feeling flirty. Their ceiling is my favorite accent, they have jars of random articles found at their bar, these also serve as great conversation starters if you're struggling with a line. Cheers!
author: Danielle L.

description: Great for cocktails. Good recipes and good bartenders. However for $10 I expect them to be stiff and these were like koolaid (albeit dill lemon koolaid).
author: Will D.

description:
so, the drink you gotta get here is the michelada.  apparently, they serve it here similarly to how it's dished up in tijuana -- beer, lime juice, and hot sauce.  you end up with something that's halfway crossed between a bloody mary and a bud light lime.  

disgusting, i thought, the first time i had it.

disgusting!!! i thought, the SECOND time i had it.

the third time i ordered it, i thought, WHY DO I KEEP ORDERING THESE?!!  but then i finished mine and drank everyone's as well.  i suppose this may be a drink that you grow to like.
author: Amy S.

description: Not impressed with the tacos, tortillas could have been a lot softer, presentation was great but the flavor and hardness of the tacos were extremely disappointing.  I will not be returning to this location.
author: Mary C.

description: Not only does Mosto have a wide variety of tequila, but the tacos al pastor and Ms. Reyes tamales are amazing.
author: Stephen R.

description: Came here for beers last Friday. only 4 beers on tap and everything else is Tequila. But they  had modelo so it was okay. They offer some snacks in Mosto as it is next to Tacolicious  but not as extensive of a menu. This place is super crowded pretty much all the time but we got a few stools at the bar. My only negative is they don't offer chips and salsa at the bar!! boo! their tacos are good but chips are always a great snack when you are at the bar. Otherwise great new addition to the mission.
author: Nicole S.

description: We only had margaritas, which were quite good.  The music was obnoxiously loud for a Wednesday night at 7.
author: Chris S.

description:
Oh man, this was simply a fortuitous stumble upon experience on New Year's Eve that had my man and I back for more this evening. On NYE I was pleased to find it mellow and not so packed around 11:30pm, we grabbed the four window seats and went on a taco-ordering frenzy. Between the four of us I think we devoured close to 20 of their $1.50 pastor tacos. Tonight (Monday) it was the same vibe at 5pm, got a small table and went loco on 12 tacos. The pastor is really nicely seasoned and served with fresh pineapple..mmm. Their two house salsas are devine, an orange salsa (made with oranges?) is thick, citrus-y and mild and the green jalepeno salsa is killer, vinegar-y and with a bit of a kick. I had the nopale taco as well which said it came with queso, but not enough to comment. It was also very good, slow cooked, nice texture. 

My boyfriend ordered their Agave flight which is a 2oz of tequila, mezcal and sotol each, bartender's selection. ya know. again, we were here for the tacos. 

I've had the Mosto house margarita (on the rocks) and the Paloma which is a grapefruit based tequila coctail. Both good, fine...$9, maybe. 

The ambiance is really chill, dim lighting wasn't so good for eating, but it makes everyone look good. I wouldn't try to roll through with a group larger than 4 to this place...if you get there early enough you can snag the 2 large top tables in the back of the bar, otherwise its tiny bar tables with a very narrow bench. Either way, don't get confused, you're here for that Pastor!

side: On NYE we did pop over to Tacolicious which I guess is an independent-ish venue (expanded menu, tacos are $3.95, taquitos for $9 etc), if I were just going out for drinks and a snack or a first time date I'd stick to Mosto.
author: Shannon H.

description: A perfect bar to start an evening or grab small bites and a drink. The margaritas are delicious and strong. The tacos are tiny but pack a lot of flavor, especially the pastor and chorizo. Lots of grilled queso fresco on the tacos, which makes you wonder why all food in life isn't topped with it. The menu changes a lot, but the specials, which vary from chicharones to ceviche, never fail to impress either. I only wish they offered happy hour.
author: Emma R.

description:
I am a big tequila fan, and any place that can offer me new drinks at a reasonable per-cocktail price is going to get a bonus star from me. I did like their food, too--just make sure you take THEIR menu and not the menu from next door. They have separate registers and menus.

The place seems like a winner if you come at the right time of night, before it gets packed. Once the crowd fills the place up, you really feel the crunch as elbow room becomes a precious commodity. And I'm certainly not one to get in the way of people having a good time with liquor, but you will find it very difficult to eat anything if there or do a tasting if drunk people are bumping into your table or stool as they try to squeeze into the bar.

There is a TV on the back wall, but I wouldn't recommend this place for a baseball game on a Friday night. The high noise levels and tunnel-design of the bar will make following the action a bit difficult.

Nice bar though, I will be going back to do my tequila snob thing.
author: Jared S.

description: Amazing Hamburgers, and tacos! What a gem! Seriously would rate this on my top five best hamburgers in the U.S. , and Ive traveled quite a bit. Great for a group. I would make reservations ahead of time for a large group.
author: Christina M.

description: They wont let me eat salsa and chips in the bar food section of the restaraunt. What kind of fake mexican facade do you think you are? Salsa and chips. Will that ruin everything? Will your restaraunt be burdened by the extra work? Are you fucking kidding me?
author: Ben J.

description: Terrible! The waitress was snotty and kept glaring at us because we sat down on our own. (There were no signs and no one at the front).  Then our server was no where to be found. (I think it took 20 minutes before we saw her again to get the check). to top it all off, manager informed us that he couldnt take anything off our bill because it would set a bad precedent. I wont be setting the precedent of giving this place my business again. Terrible.
author: Brenton M.

description: I was led to mosto under the impression that they served sangria. apparently, its the restaurant next door (same owner) that has sangria as this is strictly a tequila bar. i actually hate tequila, but i could down a margarita. so my friend and I ended up staying and having a pretty good time. i also LOVE that they serve small bites.. i had a taco which was so delish! nice little spot in the mission, i'd definitely return!
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Love tequila. Love a tequila bar... but the staff here need some serious schooling. Our waitress sat 4 obnoxiously drunk fellas at our table who commenced to pound on it, yelling at the TV, the walls and each other. The wife and I opted for a quieter corner to finish our drinks. We paid the waitress on first sighting and she ran off with a significant chunk of change and disappeared. I eventually gave up the hunt, cut my losses and joined our friends for dinner across the street.

This proved to be a miserable place for a pre-dinner cocktail. It's more the kind of place to get your party on, Cabo style. With enough tequila, this place would be just fantastic!
author: Daniel P.

description: Tequila selection is great, but the margaritas and other mixed drinks were lack luster. Mixture was pretty off to the point that the sweet and sour or agave was over used. Go there for the tequila and carnitas. Leave if you want a mixed drink. Great music selection though.
author: Carolyn S.

description: Delicious margaritas and tacos! A great place to start the night.
author: Moe D.

description: We stopped in here while waiting for a table at Tacolicious, and they made our two hour wait FLY BY!  It was my sister's bachelorette party and they treated us great!  Our bartended Ryan was by far the nicest and most friendly we had encountered this weekend, and he made her feel very special. He was also great at helping us choose the drinks that each one of us would like. Not to mention the street tacos were to die for!  If i lived in SF I would visit this place very often, but it is definitely a go to spot everytime I visit now!
author: Alyssa H.

description: Had some friends fly in from Hawaii recently and we were in San Francisco looking for a place to have some margaritas. I actually found this place last minute on Yelp and decided to check it out. Id give their margaritas 5 stars! The drinks were a little expensive but definitely worth it. I really enjoyed the atmosphere as well. The entire ceiling was made out of jars which you can unscrew and put things in for fun. Our waitress jumped up on a table to get one down for us and she was really cool. I had a blast in here and really do wanna go back there sometime to try their grapefruit drink!
author: Grace H.

description: We and the besties came here on New Years Eve because we refuse to pay a $10 cover change for Casanova. This place is best described as a New York hipster style bar and restaurant. They make their own "chicharron", there tasty with chile lime salt packaged with in house label but they are really no what I consider "chicharron" because there is no crisp fat on the underside :(. But the al pastor tacos were on point! And the drinks were nice and strong. Definitely will be back to this place, to really check out the menu and entrees!
author: Krystle S.

description: $1.50 mini-tacos, $3 tamales, $3 beers, super casual staff who're having fun (and doing shots!), and loungey cozy relaxed atmosphere.  And serving food til midnight?  Sweet.  I like it better than Tacolicious.  More civilized and cheaper...
author: Melanie C.

description: This review is long over due, as I've been frequenting Mosto for quite awhile now.  The drinks are good - little expensive though, by hey its Valencia so you can't complain too much. The burger is frickin amazing, not your typical so definitely give it a try.  Tacos are delicious as well, but the real standout here is the service; the cocktailer that is always working absolutely kills it no matter how packed it is!
author: N T.

description: The place was jumping!! really busy but worth the wait . Great Tequila selection and the  Margaritas were very tasty!!. The service was really good. we had the taco platter and tried all of them. some were really good and some were a little bland . I will come back for sure. and try some of the other items on the menu.
author: james m.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!  
Great music, great drinks and great tacos.  It's one of those rare places I feel relaxed and can hang out, not minding the wait, listen to good music while waiting and checking out good looking people. The only thing is you do have to wait, a lot, but it feels faster.
author: Ellie C.

description:
crowded hipster bar... meh 
came here for a friend's bday otherwise i wouldn't want to be here too crowded and the drinks are ok
author: Christine W.

description: The place is small but the drinks are STRONG! Get a margarita and the fresh appetizers, they are delish! Be patient, it will be crowded, but that means it is worth it.
author: Alicia K.

description:
PROS - 
TEQUILAS!!  
Service was personable and attentive
Tacos

CONS - 
The next day.....
author: Monica S.

description: This place was alright. People raved about this place, but it was nothing to really rave about. Customer service was not that great. We ran out of salsa and chips and we had to ask for refills. The set up of the good was nice. The look was better than the taste. Salsa was good though, but wouldn't come here again for over priced tacos.
author: Linda V.

description: Refreshing michelada's, extensive tequila selection, friendly bartenders, and some of the tastiest $1.50 tacos! Seriously tasty tacos!
author: Griselda L.

description: Cocktails and food might be good. But don't attempt to come here for beer or wine. Wine is awful not sure if open for long or just bad and beer selection is kinda poor. :)
author: James O.

description: Tiny spot attached to Tacolicious with tasty tequila cocktails (la paloma gets a thumbs up from me) and a fun glass jar ceiling. If I didn't have plans to feast on some tasty roast pork later on that evening, I would have been all over the roasted meat twirling on a spit near the bar. Food smelled delish!
author: Karena Q.

description: Delicious cocktails, friendly bartender and yummy food. We popped in around 9:45pm on New Year's day. It's got a cool vibe. Warm dim lighting with canning jars lining the ceiling. We sat at the bar and admired the numerous bottles of tequila. The tequila list is a pretty neat read, with witty descriptors such "burly" / "mo-fo". I'll stay away from the "burly mo-fo" type of tequilas...need something more tame such as "pink bubblegum". I ordered the La Paloma cocktail (made with Jarritos Toronja) $9 and an Al Pastor Taco $1.50 topped with a slice of pineapple. The food order arrived with miniature squeeze bottles of creamy chipotle and green sauces. I don't remember which cocktail my friend ordered but it was tasty like a margarita on the rocks $9, and he liked his tamale $3 enough to order a second one. I just needed a snack, and the little taco really hit the spot.The drinks and food came out quickly. The service was great. You look at the bartender like you need him, and he comes right over to assist you. Of course it helped that it wasn't busy. ;) The bartender was terrific with refilling our water glasses, too.
author: Liv K.

description: I love love love this place..beautiful,fun,and delicious! Friendly,knowledgable service staff. Tacos al Pastor,the La Paloma,so many great tequilas on hand,and you can totally geek out on Mezcal. LOVE
author: Shelley M.

description: tacos were just okay. Nothing amazing. The beef was too salty. Waitress provided good service. Was really really loud. Salsa was fresh. Wished the chips were warm and crispy.
author: Ju T.

description: The Tequilas were great - the hubby and I had a great time. The bartender knows his tequila stuff we think because he sure knew a lot - I don't. The blanco tequila was my favorite in the tequila flight. The food was OK - the menu seemed small and and could do with a few more choices. The service was good without being in your face.
author: Saloni H.

description: Jaime the bartender was so helpful in concocting the perfect drink! You're one superb mixologist! Thank you for defining what the standard should be! A+++!
author: Mei F.

description: Great little bar next to Tacolicious in the Mission.  Great spot to swing by for a beer, some tequila and an al pastor taco or 2.  Staff is awesome, knowledgeable and friendly.  This bar is tequila centric...so if you like the stuff, definitely go here.  Well done to the Tacolicious crew for a new cool spot.
author: Dilly M.

description: Danger!!!! cheap delicious mini tacos and several tequilas to keep you entertained at the bar for hours! my first visit to Mosto quickly ensured a long time relationship to come. 2nd date butterflies!
author: Carolina S.

description: Best tequila bar in town. Great drinks, great snacks, exceptional bartenders!
author: Tatiana N.

description: Early on...drinks are amazing. Perfectly matched tequila and their choice of fruit. Margarita Picante has a splash of red chili pepper vinegar coursing through the el jimador. If I could only do this at home. Must try the albacore tuna tostada, a new favorite food. Super cool space outside on a sunny day. Rounding down to 4 stars. Maybe a 4.5 star lunch but will wait to try more local spots to be sure.
author: Mark M.

description: I'd say this is more of a 3.5 star place, but I will round up a bit as I'm feeling generous today.  The drinks are good (but about $1 overprice imho), the service is decent and the atmosphere is refined yet relaxed.  Great place to come when you actually want to have conversation with friends.  Love the mason jars on the ceiling.  Try La Paloma, the St Germain grapefruit tequila cocktail.  Despite the fact that it was likely a dumb idea to put a Tacolicious in the middle of the Mission (and it was super dead on a Sat night at 10:30pm), Mosto actually works.
author: Toby C.

description: A dark, noisy, well-decorated bar that's nice for a decent margarita.
author: Maximillian M.

description: A fine new addition to the mission - a bar with food + a very cool ceiling.
author: Mark C.

description: Fun vibe, great bartender, fab drinks and tasty tacos!
author: Vicki L.

description: While I don't seek out tequila in general (it makes me craaaaaazy...), I stepped into this new neighborhood place the other night, and I'm so glad!  We've been watching the build-out of the new space, and were impressed with the developing ambiance, and happened to stroll by the "soft" opening on a Friday evening.  We were greeted enthusiastically by several staff and ushered through the T-Lish space, and found cozy seats at the Mosto bar.  While the wine pours could be more generous, the tequila-based Lil Devil was stiff and tasty.  There are at least 85 million kinds of tequila, and absolutely delicious little tacos with house-made spicy sauces.  The Valencia Street corridor gets thicker with great food every day...
author: Ciara W.

description: Sadly, I had eaten dinner beforehand, so I didn't take advantage of the cheap taco/tamale offerings, but I enjoyed my refreshing grapefruit-y paloma.
author: Negien M.

description: Was just there yesterday for Lunch and it was amazing. We will return to enjoy the excellent Tacos and the many other dishes you have to offer.
author: Jose A I.

description: This place is great! My hubs and I went here recently at the suggestion of a friend who lives in the area.  Everything tasted delicious and super fresh.  We had a pitcher of the house margaritas, which were perfect and not too sweet!  And split the kale salad, chicken and lime soup and the BYO taco special that night.  All were superb!  Only downfall was the server forgot our order of guacamole, but looking back now I don't think our bellies could have fit anymore food so it turned out for the best.  Can't wait to go back!
author: M S.

description:
Best tacos!!! We were so happy to find this place by chance, totally enjoyed our meal. We likely return more often with friends, I have no problem to give it a five stars.

-- I do have one concern: I saw waiters refill chip baskets by hand, I don't think they wash their hands when the place is busy. What happens if it is right after they take someone's money or credit card. So far, none of us got sick, it might not be very big concern. However, I hope staff at Mosto read this, and improve; then I have nothing to complain.
author: Liv S.

description: First of all parking sucks!....food is not that great i had way better tacos al pastor, service is really bad and they take for ever to get u anything from either the bar or any simple task....and last but not least the salsa plastic bottles look like little happy meal toys.....
author: Raul S.

description: so wish they opened later than 12 on weekends , very cheap tacos and the pastor is out of this world , burger were cooked just like they should be . amazing bread buns and  the waitress is the best part ,  here is a little conversation with her , standing by the bar where the food comes out i decided to be polite and asked her if i was in her way , she replies : don't worry if you were in the way i would have pushed you already  haha ain't she cute !!, can't wait to go back
author: NAEL K.

description: Went there to have a nice night out and WOW what a great place to hang out with Friends..The best food and drinks. Try it you will not be let down
author: Steve J.

description: love tequila and mezcal and love this place! i always sit at the bar so i can chat with the bartender and ask questions about he gazillion tequilas they have. they always have a bartender's flight which i usually get so i can try new things :-) they have some pretty good snacks too, but i come for the tequila and mezcal, sip it neat, and enjoy. yes!
author: Miss T.

description: Disappointing. I was excited to try this place--a tequila bar in the mission with an outdoor patio. Decor was fun. Pricey drinks ($9 for a tequila drink, beer was less.) and not much space. It was a Marina meets hipster/dot-com type crowd. The biggest reason for my 1 star review was the service and closing time. Apparently, this bar closes at midnight?!--it's rather strange for a bar to close so early. Our friends had just ordered drinks 5 minutes ealier and the bartenders didn't warn them they were about to close--they just happily pocketed $20+. So we had to chug expensive drinks before they booted us out. Classy.
author: J L.

description: ADORE THIS PLACE! Checked this place out over the holidays. Amazing tacos, queso & tequila cocktails at the bar after a short wait. Servers & bartenders were super, as was the food & the drinks. I have been less than impressed with the fancy cocktails at some other spots, but Mosto's drinks floored me -- in a good way! If you like hot stuff (and I do!), try the Pasion drink. Best drink I've had, maybe ever and mos def best tacos i've had in the Bay Area.
author: Lisa M.

description: Mosto is great - the bartenders are friendly and helpful and had great recommendations.  The drinks rival Latin America Club as far as alcohol content...  we didn't eat here (ate at Tacolicious) but the small menu looked great.  Love the decor and feel of the bar; great tequila and anejo selections!
author: Cheryl E.

description:
cool spot. really love the tacos behind the bar. went to their other place in the marina a while back and liked it too. make sure you check out the ceiling, it's like nothing i've ever seen before. i asked the cocktail girl if i could put stuff in a jar. she said no. ouch.

still though, mosto has a cool vibe and lots a great tequila.
author: thad b.

description: I was actually inspired to join Yelp just to write this review. Mosto has potential to be a great spot, but our blonde waitress completely ruined my experience there. I met some friends at Mosto before having dinner nearby and we all ordered a drink and some tacos. After about 20 minutes everyone had gotten their drinks and tacos - I still hadn't gotten my beer. The waitress stopped by and said it was because they had to change the keg (understandable) so I cancelled the beer since we had to leave soon for dinner. Apparently the bartender didn't get the message and still poured the beer a few minutes later - another waitstaff brought it over to me and I told him I cancelled. He said oh ok, well you can still have it. I took the beer - not really even wanting it - and our blonde waitress came over and literally GRABBED the beer out of my hand and said in a horribly rude tone "you cancelled that." Everyone at our table and nearby was pretty shocked by the incident and how loudly she yelled. I really want to like this place, but if their staff doesn't get a better attitude it will not survive.
author: jennifer d.
